                                                 id="HF8EAD80C849B4BD292B3C034F39A22AF"
                                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                                             (bb)
                                             in any other case, apply to such taxable year and to any subsequent taxable year which is within the period described in paragraph (3)(A) or (4)(A) of section 45Q(a) with respect to such equipment. 
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H52EE7ADF4F0F4C308FBCC893A207780B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       Prohibition on transfer
                                       For any taxable year described in clause (i)(II)(aa) with respect to carbon capture equipment, no election may be made by the taxpayer under section 6418(a) for such taxable year with respect to such equipment for purposes of the credit described in subsection (b)(3).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H30B8354538F94BB293305F7E0964C6D1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (iii)
                                       Revocation of election
                                       In the case of a taxpayer who makes an election described in paragraph (1)(C) with respect to carbon capture equipment, such taxpayer may, at any time during the period described in clause (i)(II)(aa), revoke the application of such election with respect to such equipment for any subsequent taxable years during such period. Any such election, if made, shall apply to the applicable year specified in such election and each subsequent taxable year within the period described in clause (i)(II)(aa). Any election under this subclause may not be subsequently revoked.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H5C5E6C6A904B40688C4D5E141616EDF5"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (D)
                                    Credit for production of clean hydrogen
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H979F5E7E45D9437189F5ECB1DE9BA6D5"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       In general
                                       In the case of the credit described in subsection (b)(5), any election under subsection (a) shall—
                                       <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="H1925441B91D143518960DECAF9198106"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                          (I)
                                          apply separately with respect to each qualified clean hydrogen production facility,
                                       
                                       <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="H3857F2F2C69C45C8968300D739CC70F3"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                          (II)
                                          be made for the taxable year in which such facility is placed in service (or within the 1-year period subsequent to the date of enactment of this section in the case of facilities placed in service before December 31, 2022), and
                                       
                                       <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="HD15F53FFA01E4EE19E06099E143D27CF"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                          (III)
                                          <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                 id="H4A8AA11537FD4FBE9A9F974EFB94BCB2"
                                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                                             (aa)
                                             in the case of a taxpayer who makes an election described in paragraph (1)(B), apply to such taxable year and the 4 subsequent taxable years with respect to such facility which end before January 1, 2033, and
                                          
                                          <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                 id="HD24DA31906E94F8A9CE9AF0F6E561FBD"
                                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                                             (bb)
                                             in any other case, apply to such taxable year and all subsequent taxable years with respect to such facility.
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H83B527ABF4364E9F8238576A5456C11F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       Prohibition on transfer
                                       For any taxable year described in clause (i)(III)(aa) with respect to a qualified clean hydrogen production facility, no election may be made by the taxpayer under section 6418(a) for such taxable year with respect to such facility for purposes of the credit described in subsection (b)(5).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H41A58AFF1B714BA2B28D737C679A7E1C"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (iii)
                                       Revocation of election
                                       In the case of a taxpayer who makes an election described in paragraph (1)(B) with respect to a qualified clean hydrogen production facility, such taxpayer may, at any time during the period described in clause (i)(III)(aa), revoke the application of such election with respect to such facility for any subsequent taxable years during such period. Any such election, if made, shall apply to the applicable year specified in such election and each subsequent taxable year within the period described in clause (i)(II)(aa). Any election under this subclause may not be subsequently revoked.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HD80B154D31A44DD99C9A31202AEAA583"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (E)
                                    Clean electricity production credit
                                    In the case of the credit described in subsection (b)(8), any election under subsection (a) shall—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H174DAB6AA8644E50B9D2ED2551427E89"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       apply separately with respect to each qualified facility,
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H681F1B8FE78B41539F0A4934FD4744D0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       be made for the taxable year in which such facility is placed in service, and
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC702351162394BBE8DB4C1EB626E0B9E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (iii)
                                       shall apply to such taxable year and to any subsequent taxable year which is within the period described in subsection (b)(1)(B) of section 45Y with respect to such facility. 
                                    
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8F25586CF8B94F29936EDF2D78BD33E4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (4)
                                 Timing
                                 The payment described in subsection (a) shall be treated as made on—
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H973D9A3567584194A65F7FA8D6C30301"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    in the case of any government, or political subdivision, described in paragraph (1) and for which no return is required under section 6011 or 6033(a), the later of the date that a return would be due under section 6033(a) if such government or subdivision were described in that section or the date on which such government or subdivision submits a claim for credit or refund (at such time and in such manner as the Secretary shall provide), and
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HF81C9EADF066403C884BC1B4240EB57F"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    in any other case, the later of the due date (determined without regard to extensions) of the return of tax for the taxable year or the date on which such return is filed.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H04D473A35D69470BBA4F5CA09E063B28"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (5)
                                 Additional information
                                 As a condition of, and prior to, any amount being treated as a payment which is made by an applicable entity under subsection (a), the Secretary may require such information or registration as the Secretary deems necessary for purposes of preventing duplication, fraud, improper payments, or excessive payments under this section.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF3D23934BA4F47AEBD6D89C47B50E219"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (6)
                                 Excessive payment
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H0F1396524C1442AA8F571FC8F04B6B57"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    In general
                                    In the case of any amount treated as a payment which is made by the applicable entity under subsection (a), or the amount of the payment made pursuant to subsection (c), which the Secretary determines constitutes an excessive payment, the tax imposed on such entity by chapter 1 (regardless of whether such entity would otherwise be subject to tax under such chapter) for the taxable year in which such determination is made shall be increased by an amount equal to the sum of—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA252F66C9DE5488980BFC2F7D944B6AB"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       the amount of such excessive payment, plus
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H02E1B01675294096BC3B7A67E308F754"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       an amount equal to 20 percent of such excessive payment. 
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H198AFA974EEA44519F9523D2ECBDD4D0"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    Reasonable cause
                                    Subparagraph (A)(ii) shall not apply if the applicable entity demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Secretary that the excessive payment resulted from reasonable cause.
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H1DA939FD5375431CB26299EE3D598E7F"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    Excessive payment defined
                                    For purposes of this paragraph, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">excessive payment means, with respect to a facility or property for which an election is made under this section for any taxable year, an amount equal to the excess of—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H63709A9241794B9499DAD29E032F1CE9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       the amount treated as a payment which is made by the applicable entity under subsection (a), or the amount of the payment made pursuant to subsection (c), with respect to such facility or property for such taxable year, over
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3C885C6945D2419CAD2A59FE016C19C0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       the amount of the credit which, without application of this section, would be otherwise allowable (as determined pursuant to paragraph (2) and without regard to section 38(c)) under this title with respect to such facility or property for such taxable year.
                                    
                                 
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H9C43E200A5384C3FBB67C7785FF2EBB8"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (e)
                              Denial of double benefit
                              In the case of an applicable entity making an election under this section with respect to an applicable credit, such credit shall be reduced to zero and shall, for any other purposes under this title, be deemed to have been allowed to such entity for such taxable year.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H683F461269E147E19E077ABF2204DED6"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (f)
                              Mirror code possessions
                              In the case of any possession of the United States with a mirror code tax system (as defined in section 24(k)), this section shall not be treated as part of the income tax laws of the United States for purposes of determining the income tax law of such possession unless such possession elects to have this section be so treated. 
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HF7E3C8DA9D254FD1B29B414EEEC629A1"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (g)
                              Basis reduction and recapture
                              Except as otherwise provided in subsection (c)(2)(A), rules similar to the rules of section 50 shall apply for purposes of this section.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HC2FAE95EB49345C4B093491E3130FB75"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (h)
                              Regulations
                              The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including guidance to ensure that the amount of the payment or deemed payment made under this section is commensurate with the amount of the credit that would be otherwise allowable (determined without regard to section 38(c)).
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC03F451BF8E24C239E25A28864819066"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Transfer of certain credits
                     Subchapter B of chapter 65, as amended by subsection (a), is amended by inserting after section 6417 the following new section:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H39155310CC4A46C988419F12EEB691DB"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H2AE257169F6E41FB8EF9879A1527646B"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes"
                                  section-type="subsequent-section">
                           6418.
                           TRANSFER OF CERTAIN CREDITS
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HB6F1BDF9B9DF42C380FB1CF2933123E5"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (a)
                              In general
                              In the case of an eligible taxpayer which elects to transfer all (or any portion specified in the election) of an eligible credit determined with respect to such taxpayer for any taxable year to a taxpayer (referred to in this section as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">transferee taxpayer) which is not related (within the meaning of section 267(b) or 707(b)(1)) to the eligible taxpayer, the transferee taxpayer specified in such election (and not the eligible taxpayer) shall be treated as the taxpayer for purposes of this title with respect to such credit (or such portion thereof).
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HFE2F9375BA954E05B224F55F5FAFA510"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (b)
                              Treatment of payments made in connection with transfer
                              With respect to any amount paid by a transferee taxpayer to an eligible taxpayer as consideration for a transfer described in subsection (a), such consideration—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4A3F6FCD0B0140C3A069B0F177330D09"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 shall be required to be paid in cash,
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5316AE4AB0B046FC94A2C5208F97DB60"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 shall not be includible in gross income of the eligible taxpayer, and
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5C6640D94EA44C83ADE6DD3A1460600B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (3)
                                 with respect to the transferee taxpayer, shall not be deductible under this title.
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HE19C60FD70C84302926B74900DD9230E"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (c)
                              Application to partnerships and S corporations
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H20A50B359DA244A8BD3270264F63BF19"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 In general
                                 In the case of any eligible credit determined with respect to any facility or property held directly by a partnership or S corporation, if such partnership or S corporation makes an election under subsection (a) (in such manner as the Secretary may provide) with respect to such credit—
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HA7E48C1E13E0483183A915D13A2BC4EA"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    any amount received as consideration for a transfer described in such subsection shall be treated as tax exempt income for purposes of sections 705 and 1366, and
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H98D21DC015D249108DA57214C5BC41FA"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    a partner’s distributive share of such tax exempt income shall be based on such partner’s distributive share of the otherwise eligible credit for each taxable year.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8D905AE29C9E46D68DE58635CB120EFC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 Coordination with application at partner or shareholder level
                                 In the case of any facility or property held directly by a partnership or S corporation, no election by any partner or shareholder shall be allowed under subsection (a) with respect to any eligible credit determined with respect to such facility or property.
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H3816916C63ED42A09B4DF8AB0593DA95"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (d)
                              Taxable year in which credit taken into account
                              In the case of any credit (or portion thereof) with respect to which an election is made under subsection (a), such credit shall be taken into account in the first taxable year of the transferee taxpayer ending with, or after, the taxable year of the eligible taxpayer with respect to which the credit was determined.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H45DC01F7E4E54C41947679332EC9F673"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (e)
                              Limitations on election
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H404C5ECEB65241CCAA256D4837D19CDD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 Time for election
                                 An election under subsection (a) to transfer any portion of an eligible credit shall be made not later than the due date (including extensions of time) for the return of tax for the taxable year for which the credit is determined, but in no event earlier than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this section. Any such election, once made, shall be irrevocable.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H26D5DCBC0C9845D3A28D63E62FD5DE02"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 No additional transfers
                                 No election may be made under subsection (a) by a transferee taxpayer with respect to any portion of an eligible credit which has been previously transferred to such taxpayer pursuant to this section.
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H55E5040EC0824C048C8A221471C90C60"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (f)
                              Definitions
                              For purposes of this section—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB1139F41078E4D19AF557545C72A01E9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 Eligible credit
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HF276BE70FBF94F0EB15B9D6A5E9938A2"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    In general
                                    The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">eligible credit means each of the following:
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HDA59C9312B5F46F987045C3A8055763B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       So much of the credit for alternative fuel vehicle refueling property allowed under section 30C which, pursuant to subsection (d)(1) of such section, is treated as a credit listed in section 38(b).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFB50EBDBB420485E8BBCE8BE4DE613FA"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       The renewable electricity production credit determined under section 45(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA419F5D6CA2D48C38BA9B034E189A989"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (iii)
                                       The credit for carbon oxide sequestration determined under section 45Q(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H012E3FEB2DF045DDA10734C52DC63408"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (iv)
                                       The zero-emission nuclear power production credit determined under section 45U(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H14CD10E8C60D4754AB51618E5E93E6F9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (v)
                                       The clean hydrogen production credit determined under section 45V(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H470E0E5128B44B05858E45019489E325"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (vi)
                                       The advanced manufacturing production credit determined under section 45X(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE1027605CB384E60969395FA9CB7796B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (vii)
                                       The clean electricity production credit determined under section 45Y(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HBF2A49B2B5E4492C84BFD4D0D426FAFD"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (viii)
                                       The clean fuel production credit determined under section 45Z(a).
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H460418CC90E84D4890C394714376D973"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ix)
                                       The energy credit determined under section 48.
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0921F8CDA33448A4A95CE2CC6B5BA9C9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (x)
                                       The qualifying advanced energy project credit determined under section 48C.
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA3F5C6D6B4FA4DAD8DB5DEF3678CF4A6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (xi)
                                       The clean electricity investment credit determined under section 48E.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H65932F52832F4E909215FBD5F9889E28"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    Election for certain credits
                                    In the case of any eligible credit described in clause (ii), (iii), (v), or (vii) of subparagraph (A), an election under subsection (a) shall be made—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HAEA08F3E529344A8A62165CD82F2265B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       separately with respect to each facility for which such credit is determined, and
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1A8FF09B9FD0460A9C01FA6F406B3A09"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       for each taxable year during the 10-year period beginning on the date such facility was originally placed in service (or, in the case of the credit described in clause (iii), for each year during the 12-year period beginning on the date the carbon capture equipment was originally placed in service at such facility).
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HF3584735B2C346E9ACA627644E69C735"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    Exception for business credit carryforwards or carrybacks
                                    The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">eligible credit shall not include any business credit carryforward or business credit carryback determined under section 39.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H23C265ADCF464289A33F09D6D7818036"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 Eligible taxpayer
                                 The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">eligible taxpayer means any taxpayer which is not described in section 6417(d)(1)(A).
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H8ADD7A2DCDDA4EE5A0F16002062593AE"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (g)
                              Special rules
                              For purposes of this section—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAF5336DF82B14E7A8AFD969213A8BFBA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 Additional information
                                 As a condition of, and prior to, any transfer of any portion of an eligible credit pursuant to subsection (a), the Secretary may require such information (including, in such form or manner as is determined appropriate by the Secretary, such information returns) or registration as the Secretary deems necessary for purposes of preventing duplication, fraud, improper payments, or excessive payments under this section.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF1285E2FDC9948F5803469385EC950E6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 Excessive credit transfer
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H06918F1398E94510863C6E0F15FFFF2F"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    In general
                                    In the case of any portion of an eligible credit which is transferred to a transferee taxpayer pursuant to subsection (a) which the Secretary determines constitutes an excessive credit transfer, the tax imposed on the transferee taxpayer by chapter 1 (regardless of whether such entity would otherwise be subject to tax under such chapter) for the taxable year in which such determination is made shall be increased by an amount equal to the sum of—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE55367EE84864AF3994763C6CD11E676"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       the amount of such excessive credit transfer, plus
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA62238FA9E80456F96CF3172B949020E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       an amount equal to 20 percent of such excessive credit transfer. 
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HCD5C83EF55B64CB5BC5066E382C6190A"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    Reasonable cause
                                    Subparagraph (A)(ii) shall not apply if the transferee taxpayer demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Secretary that the excessive credit transfer resulted from reasonable cause.
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H52EA62FD00E942E5AEB1FDB61B5D27BA"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    Excessive credit transfer defined
                                    For purposes of this paragraph, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">excessive credit transfer means, with respect to a facility or property for which an election is made under subsection (a) for any taxable year, an amount equal to the excess of—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H46D7A9AC8F8C4E8B99043C8851625719"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       the amount of the eligible credit claimed by the transferee taxpayer with respect to such facility or property for such taxable year, over
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB463E03B05EF4A49983B44A79A3A58CF"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       the amount of such credit which, without application of this section, would be otherwise allowable under this title with respect to such facility or property for such taxable year.
                                    
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H559593CCE70D45DB8B25E20941B579CC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (3)
                                 Basis reduction; notification of recapture
                                 In the case of any election under subsection (a) with respect to any portion of an eligible credit described in clauses (ix) through (xi) of subsection (f)(1)(A)—
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H5003D2851D8C43F1BAFF8FA681AEE112"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    subsection (c) of section 50 shall apply to the applicable investment credit property (as defined in subsection (a)(5) of such section) as if such eligible credit was allowed to the eligible taxpayer, and
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HF849075528F146C8B095B4017A17CD53"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    if, during any taxable year, the applicable investment credit property (as defined in subsection (a)(5) of section 50) is disposed of, or otherwise ceases to be investment credit property with respect to the eligible taxpayer, before the close of the recapture period (as described in subsection (a)(1) of such section)—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE29DEF446BB84F238FEB01771A04CC95"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       such eligible taxpayer shall provide notice of such occurrence to the transferee taxpayer (in such form and manner as the Secretary shall prescribe), and 
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H8F765C9F2916448FA8C9400B5D1455FE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       the transferee taxpayer shall provide notice of the recapture amount (as defined in subsection (c)(2) of such section), if any, to the eligible taxpayer (in such form and manner as the Secretary shall prescribe).
                                    
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H42B8299AAAB941598A3E7112F3F16E6E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (4)
                                 Prohibition on election or transfer with respect to progress expenditures
                                 This section shall not apply with respect to any amount of an eligible credit which is allowed pursuant to rules similar to the rules of subsections (c)(4) and (d) of section 46 (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1990).
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H421E812C66934153904B7D47B4E01AAA"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (h)
                              Regulations
                              The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including regulations or other guidance providing rules for determining a partner’s distributive share of the tax exempt income described in subsection (c)(1).
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5B8D9AC903084BC68F8B81D8523C8B44"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Real estate investment trusts
                     
                        Section 50(d) is amended by adding at the end the following: <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">In the case of a real estate investment trust making an election under section 6418, paragraphs (1)(B) and (2)(B) of the section 46(e) referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection shall not apply to any investment credit property of such real estate investment trust to which such election applies..
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HDE3CA8CA008442AD86FB13BA60516D33"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     3-year carryback for applicable credits
                     
                        Section 39(a) is amended by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"

                              this section shall be applied separately from the business credit (other than the applicable credit),
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H61AACB046E0C484DA838FD1C8B793BCA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 by substituting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">23 taxable years for <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">21 taxable years in subparagraph (A) thereof, and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                       qb-display-quote="yes">

                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB913F69C7B6248DEADD30D3E9950CC9B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Clerical amendment
                     The table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65 is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 6416 the following new items:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H791CD1BB7A284E8AB24B3A948165E855"

                              lowest-level="section"
                              quoted-block="no-quoted-block"
                              regeneration="no-regeneration">

                                       level="section">Sec. 6417. Elective payment of applicable credits.

                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HA39F4AFCA5594A83884B86B2AD182792"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (f)
                     Gross-up of direct spending
                     Beginning in fiscal year 2023 and each fiscal year thereafter, the portion of any payment made to a taxpayer pursuant to an election under section 6417 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, or any amount treated as a payment which is made by the taxpayer under subsection (a) of such section, that is direct spending shall be increased by 6.0445 percent.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEBAB06A8210C4F9495CE9CF211924484"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (g)
                     Effective date
                     The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC588BB6D8317479F9A4EA16BF987F8DC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  13802.
                  APPROPRIATIONS
                  Immediately upon the enactment of this Act, in addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $500,000,000 to remain available until September 30, 2031, for necessary expenses for the Internal Revenue Service to carry out this subtitle (and the amendments made by this subtitle), which shall supplement and not supplant any other appropriations that may be available for this purpose.

               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H00AC8483E73442488E9C2156BFE690C5"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  13903.
                  REINSTATEMENT OF LIMITATION RULES FOR DEDUCTION FOR STATE AND LOCAL, ETC., TAXES; EXTENSION OF LIMITATION ON EXCESS BUSINESS LOSSES OF NONCORPORATE TAXPAYERS
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HD6720720F07D42CEB0F30B7705334544"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Reinstatement of limitation rules for deduction for State and local, etc., taxes
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0266717C74F0421E8842CF83E24269FF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        Section 164(b)(6), as amended by section 13904, is further amended—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA57ECB0AA15C4E5F9D8191D9F34768B4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           in the heading, by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">
                                 2026
                               and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                                 2025
                              , and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6C942E119E824D69B9CCC3B58EF7012C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  13904.
                  REMOVAL OF HARMFUL SMALL BUSINESS TAXES; EXTENSION OF LIMITATION ON DEDUCTION FOR STATE AND LOCAL, ETC., TAXES
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H93A5BAB039B647C688AD14B0DE005102"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Removal of harmful small business taxes
                     Subparagraph (D) of section 59(k)(1), as added by section 10101, is amended to read as follows:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HC5F79E70B2D246378CF3D8ACE5EDE0D4"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3426BB93AF094EAF9B89AA5A42D73130"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Special rules for determining applicable corporation status
                           Solely for purposes of determining whether a corporation is an applicable corporation under this paragraph, all adjusted financial statement income of persons treated as a single employer with such corporation under subsection (a) or (b) of section 52 shall be treated as adjusted financial statement income of such corporation, and adjusted financial statement income of such corporation shall be determined without regard to paragraphs (2)(D)(i) and (11) of section 56A(c).
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC1D8B5E9029A4303AAE3952E3D4C20A7"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Extension of limitation on deduction for State and local, etc., taxes
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3A19DA7D957D4419B7B57D1C30A2D470"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        
                           Section 164(b)(6) is amended—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7C61814BF858445C9194DD84CB2E4852"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           in the heading, by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">
                                 2025
                               and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">
                                 2026
                              , and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7307C4EEFB40483E821BEE3B1B034BCD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"

      <title id="H41FB8762F8FC4E0E98353EA741318D39"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         II
         COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE, NUTRITION, AND FORESTRY
         <subtitle id="H7944EA0BA38C43B1AB2C913D413C470E"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            A
            General provisions
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H7F6658E8C0CF4F89AA3FA75B3D29CEE0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               20001.
               DEFINITION OF SECRETARY
               In this title, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture. 
            
         
         <subtitle id="HD3DC9FA94B7642298E42029C44D2D730"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            B
            Conservation
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H56E7633668194E4290B4D24C713B8A42"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               21001.
               ADDITIONAL AGRICULTURAL CONSERVATION INVESTMENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H35628C1539244BEB8AFC11AAD3A3FC56"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available (and subject to subsection (b)), there are appropriated to the Secretary, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031 (subject to the condition that no such funds may be disbursed after September 30, 2031)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H001EBDC2B2F14CF88565241370D9DDD7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     to carry out, using the facilities and authorities of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the environmental quality incentives program under subchapter A of chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa through 3839aa–8)— 
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H063479E7674742599B43B585E03D46DB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H748D9CB6711D43E89C62DF9A7CCEF412"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2023; 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H544ED935D5514194A3F12E13D5B44EE8"
                                 indent="subparagraph"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           $1,750,000,000 for fiscal year 2024;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H05ED017F0C494F9BB1E0B5517E6859A9"
                                 indent="subparagraph"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           $3,000,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE5B666A6281C4CA3952B4C727EBCA04A"
                                 indent="subparagraph"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           $3,450,000,000 for fiscal year 2026; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7860087683A74AEC9F12DFDA3B409F50"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        subject to the conditions on the use of the funds that—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEDA84E0BA18545A388D1AB11D5A5AB92"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           section 1240B(f)(1) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–2(f)(1)) shall not apply;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9AECC9CE25A44993B4744E7FAF5765B5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           section 1240H(c)(2) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–8(c)(2)) shall be applied—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4D30820C99864702BCD3094142E232AE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              by substituting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">$50,000,000 for <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">$25,000,000; and

                                       id="HC166C201A6F745DCA731F38AC1D1111D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              with the Secretary prioritizing proposals that utilize diet and feed management to reduce enteric methane emissions from ruminants; and
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC15FAC78E2A44C88B7EDFA5A44A5028E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           the funds shall be available for 1 or more agricultural conservation practices or enhancements that the Secretary determines directly improve soil carbon, reduce nitrogen losses, or reduce, capture, avoid, or sequester carbon dioxide, methane, or nitrous oxide emissions, associated with agricultural production; 
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H221FA5B58D2A495EA53C17330DE0F05B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to carry out, using the facilities and authorities of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the conservation stewardship program under subchapter B of that chapter (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–21 through 3839aa–25)—

                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA80D21AB866F47D8B421D6CC18909E74"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">

               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H80B6693DFB1A497184A9EA6B7123F607"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conditions
                  The funds made available under subsection (a) are subject to the conditions that the Secretary shall not—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H405FB4A80FE34CE2B7FBBDF12814E150"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     enter into any agreement—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E06015C56614523852DC39DF13D42C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        that is for a term extending beyond September 30, 2031; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB5022114B9E24C639019AFF2279F055A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        under which any payment could be outlaid or funds disbursed after September 30, 2031; or
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H791E599C69E4412AB326F629F0E80B07"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     use any other funds available to the Secretary to satisfy obligations initially made under this section.

                           (ii)
                           by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">2023 each place it appears and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">2031.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7D0F5C72E41B4DB281AB1C0DEA5D48BE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Section 1244(n)(3)(A) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844(n)(3)(A)) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">2023 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">2031.

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3B48F3BF1E644969A84D99E470D60A05"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               21002.
               CONSERVATION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H322FEFE28CD147E298BBF2D33895C3F7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available (and subject to subsection (b)), there are appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031 (subject to the condition that no such funds may be disbursed after September 30, 2031)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC886B6B18F034BC0B1D4C6A99734551F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     $1,000,000,000 to provide conservation technical assistance through the Natural Resources Conservation Service; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6795F5DB43754FBEBFB4A44B596E3052"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     $300,000,000 to carry out a program to quantify carbon sequestration and carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide emissions, through which the Natural Resources Conservation Service shall collect field-based data to assess the carbon sequestration and reduction in carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide emissions outcomes associated with activities carried out pursuant to this section and use the data to monitor and track those carbon sequestration and emissions trends through the Greenhouse Gas Inventory and Assessment Program of the Department of Agriculture.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA795114D9DF1413CA6CF2C86156DF80D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conditions
                  The funds made available under this section are subject to the conditions that the Secretary shall not—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7D64EC172A704E2B901EE5E9E3327720"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     enter into any agreement—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB7B1C7C75CB640059D984CF41FBE34F1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        that is for a term extending beyond September 30, 2031; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7007356340164F8790D1F3C053DD26FC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        under which any payment could be outlaid or funds disbursed after September 30, 2031; 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE791CABB5C5949A4A24B120C09A094EA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     use any other funds available to the Secretary to satisfy obligations initially made under this section; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H903C7FB6DD6B42EEB34DCD4F03CCDB2A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     interpret this section to authorize funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation for activities under this section if such funds are not expressly authorized or currently expended for such purposes.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBDD7ABB057EB4C62AE98DFC908A5730A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Administrative costs
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028, for administrative costs of the agencies and offices of the Department of Agriculture for costs related to implementing this section.

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22001.
               ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR ELECTRIC LOANS FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY
               Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 8103) is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HE66DD29A72F34F7D991BE3E7F47F9F65"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HADCACF33F9184B878DC32819326A4184"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (h)
                     Additional funding for electric loans for renewable energy
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF1B7AD404F624C1789290630BAEC4BFF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Appropriations
                        Notwithstanding subsections (a) through (e), and (g), in addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $1,000,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the cost of loans under section 317 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 940g), including for projects that store electricity that support the types of eligible projects under that section, which shall be forgiven in an amount that is not greater than 50 percent of the loan based on how the borrower and the project meets the terms and conditions for loan forgiveness consistent with the purposes of that section established by the Secretary, except as provided in paragraph (3). 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H14B17D378D5D40439AADAADF06AF6976"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Limitation
                        The Secretary shall not enter into any loan agreement pursuant this subsection that could result in disbursements after September 30, 2031.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H409C3615ED2A47CD996C6CB58A164E38"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Exception
                        The Secretary shall establish criteria for waiving the 50 percent limitation described in paragraph (1).
                     
                  
                  .
