                      id="H92835DAA756540588D20D29D21AF51E5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22003.
               BIOFUEL INFRASTRUCTURE AND AGRICULTURE PRODUCT MARKET EXPANSION
               Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 8103) (as amended by section 22001) is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H857EBD5608FE470EAC448DAB04E1FDA2"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H46E2D36068974BFA8E70749DF734A26C"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (i)
                     Biofuel infrastructure and agriculture product market expansion
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9E15A8EBCA2E45B39E6557960FEBDE6A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Appropriation
                        Notwithstanding subsections (a) through (e) and subsection (g), in addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $500,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to carry out this subsection.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H94E58B4E3667435B8A5F2F3DE5330E8B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Use of funds
                        The Secretary shall use the amounts made available by paragraph (1) to provide grants, for which the Federal share shall be not more than 75 percent of the total cost of carrying out a project for which the grant is provided, on a competitive basis, to increase the sale and use of agricultural commodity-based fuels through infrastructure improvements for blending, storing, supplying, or distributing biofuels, except for transportation infrastructure not on location where such biofuels are blended, stored, supplied, or distributed—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6FA335EA72684BB3B5374D2FFB261A10"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           by installing, retrofitting, or otherwise upgrading fuel dispensers or pumps and related equipment, storage tank system components, and other infrastructure required at a location related to dispensing certain biofuel blends to ensure the increased sales of fuels with high levels of commodity-based ethanol and biodiesel that are at or greater than the levels required in the Notice of Funding Availability for the Higher Blends Infrastructure Incentive Program for Fiscal Year 2020, published in the Federal Register (85 Fed. Reg. 26656), as determined by the Secretary; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD4DE3A5A234744938812C8DAD019359A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           by building and retrofitting home heating oil distribution centers or equivalent entities and distribution systems for ethanol and biodiesel blends.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H1CD46F77EA2A41428BE616173C0683A1"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22004.
               USDA ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL ELECTRIC COOPERATIVES
               Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 8103) (as amended by section 22003) is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H00399C0E28B94A83AA125547C488A053"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H2300E59D7D124748BDDD564E4BB7BB7F"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (j)
                     USDA assistance for rural electric cooperatives
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5E72E58B51C142E799D24FA414332C7A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Appropriation
                        Notwithstanding subsections (a) through (e) and (g), in addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $9,700,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the long-term resiliency, reliability, and affordability of rural electric systems by providing to an eligible entity (defined as an electric cooperative described in section 501(c)(12) or 1381(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and is or has been a Rural Utilities Service electric loan borrower pursuant to the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 or serving a predominantly rural area or a wholly or jointly owned subsidiary of such electric cooperative) loans, modifications of loans, the cost of loans and modifications, and other financial assistance to achieve the greatest reduction in carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide emissions associated with rural electric systems through the purchase of renewable energy, renewable energy systems, zero-emission systems, and carbon capture and storage systems, to deploy such systems, or to make energy efficiency improvements to electric generation and transmission systems of the eligible entity after the date of enactment of this subsection. 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H469668300EDD4ED0993527FCBD65F5E0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Limitation
                        No eligible entity may receive an amount equal to more than 10 percent of the total amount made available by this subsection.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCD0C1A9FD0AB4F0DAF507C4C71287F59"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Requirement
                        The amount of a grant under this subsection shall be not more than 25 percent of the total project costs of the eligible entity carrying out a project using a grant under this subsection.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H792F896236164EC2A2279C90987C423E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Prohibition
                        Nothing in this subsection shall be interpreted to authorize funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation for activities under this subsection if such funds are not expressly authorized or currently expended for such purposes.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF84A63FFF7214D1DAD867A786C157AAA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        Disbursements
                        The Secretary shall not enter into, pursuant to this subsection—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H96BE05F5D18A4CEAA94F36CF34A00E56"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           any loan agreement that may result in a disbursement after September 30, 2031; or 
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H87094BFAB2F0476888CA5C0D0050C1D5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           any grant agreement that may result in any outlay after September 30, 2031.
                        
                     
                  
                  .

                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22005.
               ADDITIONAL USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for administrative costs and salaries and expenses for the Rural Development mission area and administrative costs of the agencies and offices of the Department for costs related to implementing this subtitle. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H34650B1A0A84415D941285C215C4A745"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22006.
               FARM LOAN IMMEDIATE RELIEF FOR BORROWERS WITH AT-RISK AGRICULTURAL OPERATIONS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of amounts in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to provide payments to, for the cost of loans or loan modifications for, or to carry out section 331(b)(4) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1981(b)(4)) with respect to distressed borrowers of direct or guaranteed loans administered by the Farm Service Agency under subtitle A, B, or C of that Act (7 U.S.C. 1922 through 1970). In carrying out this section, the Secretary shall provide relief to those borrowers whose agricultural operations are at financial risk as expeditiously as possible, as determined by the Secretary. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB14BDAF580BF47AD8C166BC22182E365"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22007.
               USDA ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT FOR UNDERSERVED FARMERS, RANCHERS, AND FORESTERS
               Section 1006 of the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 (7 U.S.C. 2279 note; Public Law 117–2) is amended to read as follows:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H4D5827AAF9964212A3CE2FD9BBBA27DC"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H85B67748B67B448F83B6F994F3D61CD7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     1006.
                     USDA ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT FOR UNDERSERVED FARMERS, RANCHERS, FORESTERS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3CBF900A30BA4ECEB2FAC4AD0859567A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Technical and other assistance
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $125,000,000 to provide outreach, mediation, financial training, capacity building training, cooperative development and agricultural credit training and support, and other technical assistance on issues concerning food, agriculture, agricultural credit, agricultural extension, rural development, or nutrition to underserved farmers, ranchers, or forest landowners, including veterans, limited resource producers, beginning farmers and ranchers, and farmers, ranchers, and forest landowners living in high poverty areas. 
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HDD3A872849944F7DA0F46A827266E207"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Land loss assistance
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000 to provide grants and loans to eligible entities, as determined by the Secretary, to improve land access (including heirs’ property and fractionated land issues) for underserved farmers, ranchers, and forest landowners, including veterans, limited resource producers, beginning farmers and ranchers, and farmers, ranchers, and forest landowners living in high poverty areas.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H9E3CB7B3D01E40C8995ED1B4AE420586"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Equity commissions
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $10,000,000 to fund the activities of one or more equity commissions that will address racial equity issues within the Department of Agriculture and the programs of the Department of Agriculture.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H01008925160D4D11AE05F94A7941114A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Research, education, and extension
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000 to support and supplement agricultural research, education, and extension, as well as scholarships and programs that provide internships and pathways to agricultural sector or Federal employment, for 1890 Institutions (as defined in section 2 of the Agricultural, Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7601)), 1994 Institutions (as defined in section 532 of the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 301 note; Public Law 103–382)), Alaska Native serving institutions and Native Hawaiian serving institutions eligible to receive grants under subsections (a) and (b), respectively, of section 1419B of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3156), Hispanic-serving institutions eligible to receive grants under section 1455 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3241), and the insular area institutions of higher education located in the territories of the United States, as referred to in section 1489 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3361).
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H868D3A48285945189F4476191C969263"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (e)
                        Discrimination financial assistance
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,200,000,000 for a program to provide financial assistance, including the cost of any financial assistance, to farmers, ranchers, or forest landowners determined to have experienced discrimination prior to January 1, 2021, in Department of Agriculture farm lending programs, under which the amount of financial assistance provided to a recipient may be not more than $500,000, as determined to be appropriate based on any consequences experienced from the discrimination, which program shall be administered through 1 or more qualified nongovernmental entities selected by the Secretary subject to standards set and enforced by the Secretary.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H46D605A559E341CA8FFBFD69352FE34A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (f)
                        Administrative costs
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal year 2022, to remain available until September 30, 2031, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $24,000,000 for administrative costs, including training employees, of the agencies and offices of the Department of Agriculture to carry out this section.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H8CD77A61E1FE4C9DB3E077D70C59B098"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (g)
                        Limitation
                        The funds made available under this section are subject to the condition that the Secretary shall not—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCAEE376F3CF540D5A36B446D58286B31"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           enter into any agreement under which any payment could be outlaid or funds disbursed after September 30, 2031; or
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4D94EC68520E4E71BFB2FDD5E2266D78"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           use any other funds available to the Secretary to satisfy obligations initially made under this section.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H801D6E45BF0F4B6DBC0ED15470FAEC06"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               22008.
               REPEAL OF FARM LOAN ASSISTANCE
               Section 1005 of the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 (7 U.S.C. 1921 note; Public Law 117–2) is repealed. 
            
         
         <subtitle id="H40F89EC97DCC4821847BA12616A9DCDD"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            D
            Forestry
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2C42F681A5BD4E478CA2EE72A92A9099"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               23001.
               NATIONAL FOREST SYSTEM RESTORATION AND FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HED25D0677EC44619A67B7DED20738D44"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H85F7FA927FA44487BB60A350F71A1C10"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     $1,800,000,000 for hazardous fuels reduction projects on National Forest System land within the wildland-urban interface;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H24D6578DB6014F1EB55A411952489592"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     $200,000,000 for vegetation management projects on National Forest System land carried out in accordance with a plan developed under section 303(d)(1) or 304(a)(3) of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6542(d)(1) or 6543(a)(3));
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H883490BB10ED45A692ADD7E08B79958F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     $100,000,000 to provide for environmental reviews by the Chief of the Forest Service in satisfying the obligations of the Chief of the Forest Service under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 through 4370m–12); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2F4B888409E34A62BC46942FDC8E4039"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     $50,000,000 for the protection of old-growth forests on National Forest System land and to complete an inventory of old-growth forests and mature forests within the National Forest System.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H053D89E0DC65419E93A9E4B2338DC019"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Restrictions
                  None of the funds made available by paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (a) may be used for any activity—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0555F95FDBFD45EAA9115C7A2FAF3F29"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     conducted in a wilderness area or wilderness study area;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4E4812557AD242F790F1577CCDD34F02"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     that includes the construction of a permanent road or motorized trail;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD08FEF48436A4682AB65B6E17CAC9E81"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     that includes the construction of a temporary road, except in the case of a temporary road that is decommissioned by the Secretary not later than 3 years after the earlier of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFEC4B7AA00184D6FA4F6D305268777DA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the date on which the temporary road is no longer needed; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0AB599D5C7DA425F8BD983ED876CB78B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the date on which the project for which the temporary road was constructed is completed;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8DCF8F7F57AB4D3890DB30CC2A73A797"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     inconsistent with the applicable land management plan;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H39189DBFFA39435EB5505217F4B9A5E5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     inconsistent with the prohibitions of the rule of the Forest Service entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Special Areas; Roadless Area Conservation (66 Fed. Reg. 3244 (January 12, 2001)), as modified by subparts C and D of part 294 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H81D69E7D83704F838A17E8C67070D0AF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     carried out on any land that is not National Forest System land, including other forested land on Federal, State, Tribal, or private land.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H853DE9F0D50A4B77BC2F3BD13C50D371"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Limitations
                  Nothing in this section shall be interpreted to authorize funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation for activities under this section if such funds are not expressly authorized or currently expended for such purposes.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H40A025C18DEB42A38AFA636713FB32FE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Cost-sharing waiver
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF95B91F5F3BA4CCA86F876E18378DCCC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The non-Federal cost-share requirement of a project described in paragraph (2) may be waived at the discretion of the Secretary.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6A0F18A652EC42C1B5ADF5CF1507E8F0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Project described
                     A project referred to in paragraph (1) is a project that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3F1AB8C72236456084FE88D0A67A5CB9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        is carried out using funds made available under this section;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD47B913815484D33A814DFF5D93E88B2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        requires a partnership agreement, including a cooperative agreement or mutual interest agreement; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6FF0D9B654D74D51839817156837F937"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        is subject to a non-Federal cost-share requirement.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCA05C58E1B4B46F29F9776DCBA6092EE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H704C7D383257486780E34F52E7782441"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Decommission
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">decommission means, with respect to a road—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0F0544A8A14344CB9C7FA3AF4924C7F8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        reestablishing native vegetation on the road;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H599257E764934F8CAF6E5F9C921A3F56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        restoring any natural drainage, watershed function, or other ecological processes that were disrupted or adversely impacted by the road by removing or hydrologically disconnecting the road prism and reestablishing stable slope contours; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H04CE87118CA0416CA1B2CF73616ABB54"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        effectively blocking the road to vehicular traffic, where feasible.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDB16995DD23F4E2A8AF864D8D341AAA5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Ecological integrity
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">ecological integrity has the meaning given the term in section 219.19 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9C8E3FC0A341491582DF2F5440EB6C43"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Hazardous fuels reduction project
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">hazardous fuels reduction project means an activity, including the use of prescribed fire, to protect structures and communities from wildfire that is carried out on National Forest System land.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDBA8F5F8D18F4AA6917DAFBB94C08FE0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Restoration
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">restoration has the meaning given the term in section 219.19 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA09932D16D9F4A5CB11F12351A2D59CB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Vegetation management project
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">vegetation management project means an activity carried out on National Forest System land to enhance the ecological integrity and achieve the restoration of a forest ecosystem through the removal of vegetation, the use of prescribed fire, the restoration of aquatic habitat, or the decommissioning of an unauthorized, temporary, or system road.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2F9790C40FCA4DDB805767E0F08AC9E9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Wildland-urban interface
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">wildland-urban interface has the meaning given the term in section 101 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6511). 
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4B644152E6944A39B8986690F5880D5C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               23002.
               COMPETITIVE GRANTS FOR NON-FEDERAL FOREST LANDOWNERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCEA9A0F0BD974E9CB6032A654CDF9C46"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF02FE6A3610140E3B49B8B325BC4F7F3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     $150,000,000 for the competitive grant program under section 13A of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109a) for providing through that program a cost share to carry out climate mitigation or forest resilience practices in the case of underserved forest landowners, subject to the condition that subsection (h) of that section shall not apply;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3ACFD1BEC02840F4BB901E65997A0C91"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     $150,000,000 for the competitive grant program under section 13A of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109a) for providing through that program grants to support the participation of underserved forest landowners in emerging private markets for climate mitigation or forest resilience, subject to the condition that subsection (h) of that section shall not apply;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2D4542D835F9466FBD76C96B0812F574"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     $100,000,000 for the competitive grant program under section 13A of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109a) for providing through that program grants to support the participation of forest landowners who own less than 2,500 acres of forest land in emerging private markets for climate mitigation or forest resilience, subject to the condition that subsection (h) of that section shall not apply;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2FDE71D517D24BBCA26196B0B9F60577"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     $50,000,000 for the competitive grant program under section 13A of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109a) to provide grants to states and other eligible entities to provide payments to owners of private forest land for implementation of forestry practices on private forest land, that are determined by the Secretary, based on the best available science, to provide measurable increases in carbon sequestration and storage beyond customary practices on comparable land, subject to the conditions that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H173AB0B5F9D84B6EB8A8ECE0E503BBE3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        those payments shall not preclude landowners from participation in other public and private sector financial incentive programs; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H24BAF6B2F04644678F191B6D0909A68F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        subsection (h) of that section shall not apply; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H52B616A96A8F42BE9BE06B0D697C09AB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     $100,000,000 to provide grants under the wood innovation grant program under section 8643 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 (7 U.S.C. 7655d), including for the construction of new facilities that advance the purposes of the program and for the hauling of material removed to reduce hazardous fuels to locations where that material can be utilized, subject to the conditions that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA76187AAA164697AE1AADEC9ED2CD6B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the amount of such a grant shall be not more than $5,000,000; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6686997B66E34D038499A8E13B2E66B6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        notwithstanding subsection (d) of that section, a recipient of such a grant shall provide funds equal to not less than 50 percent of the amount received under the grant, to be derived from non-Federal sources.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0023EDD49A154E12BFEC26B81D0DF76D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Cost-sharing requirement
                  Any partnership agreements, including cooperative agreements and mutual interest agreements, using funds made available under this section shall be subject to a non-Federal cost-share requirement of not less than 20 percent of the project cost, which may be waived at the discretion of the Secretary. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H04CA04D6E99647AAB061DF8830411446"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Limitations
                  Nothing in this section shall be interpreted to authorize funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation for activities under this section if such funds are not expressly authorized or currently expended for such purposes.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HAE3EE5256E4A4037BE7857754F188458"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               23003.
               STATE AND PRIVATE FORESTRY CONSERVATION PROGRAMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE6FD34740E0B4A6488A62FC601AEB1F4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4A77905F22C949AB813B9D68F207ED65"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     $700,000,000 to provide competitive grants to States through the Forest Legacy Program established under section 7 of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2103c) for projects for the acquisition of land and interests in land; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9C8172E0285644E58664A3245D0DA8DE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     $1,500,000,000 to provide multiyear, programmatic, competitive grants to a State agency, a local governmental entity, an agency or governmental entity of the District of Columbia, an agency or governmental entity of an insular area (as defined in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103)), an Indian Tribe, or a nonprofit organization through the Urban and Community Forestry Assistance program established under section 9(c) of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2105(c)) for tree planting and related activities. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5D611FE866824408915CFE8BDB7617B8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Waiver
                  Any non-Federal cost-share requirement otherwise applicable to projects carried out under this section may be waived at the discretion of the Secretary.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H50BB47C0A421481AA9B4B0FA8579B288"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               23004.
               LIMITATION
               The funds made available under this subtitle are subject to the condition that the Secretary shall not—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD79AF8D018AF45519BC8687B7C5CA00F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  enter into any agreement—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCCA2256435D3432088A78FEAA2B69425"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     that is for a term extending beyond September 30, 2031; or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2C119EC99CC44254B2BA5DA916CEA4B3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     under which any payment could be outlaid or funds disbursed after September 30, 2031; or
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCD3D40A33BF747739DEDA4BA1C61D00E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  use any other funds available to the Secretary to satisfy obligations initially made under this subtitle.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H558FBC5321B5401D887A83B5986946D9"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               23005.
               ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000 to remain available until September 30, 2031, for administrative costs of the agencies and offices of the Department of Agriculture for costs related to implementing this subtitle. 
            
         
      
      <title id="H16164892FDF347828CD85A023A85F575"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         III
         COMMITTEE ON BANKING, HOUSING, AND URBAN AFFAIRS
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7CDE1104F0364FBF8E8CC28045338513"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            30001.
            ENHANCED USE OF DEFENSE PRODUCTION ACT OF 1950
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $500,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2024, to carry out the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. 4501 et seq.).
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9B0C4837001C47679FF776E7A0FFF1B4"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            30002.
            IMPROVING ENERGY EFFICIENCY OR WATER EFFICIENCY OR CLIMATE RESILIENCE OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE1B76D8C66264512806060B51EAE1047"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Appropriation
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Secretary) for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H27254426D4224670B693B91ADC51B647"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  $837,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028, for the cost of providing direct loans, the costs of modifying such loans, and for grants, as provided for and subject to terms and conditions in subsection (b), including to subsidize gross obligations for the principal amount of such loans, not to exceed $4,000,000,000, to fund projects that improve energy or water efficiency, enhance indoor air quality or sustainability, implement the use of zero-emission electricity generation, low-emission building materials or processes, energy storage, or building electrification strategies, or address climate resilience, of an eligible property;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB7C110BE624C488D9FA16CCA571B6E1B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  $60,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2030, for the costs to the Secretary for information technology, research and evaluation, and administering and overseeing the implementation of this section;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H429B0CD91AD344FCA87D3E2830EA23F3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  $60,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2029, for expenses of contracts or cooperative agreements administered by the Secretary; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H820B0D3C1F1747AB9AD789170A0D74D3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  $42,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028, for energy and water benchmarking of properties eligible to receive grants or loans under this section, regardless of whether they actually received such grants or loans, along with associated data analysis and evaluation at the property and portfolio level, and the development of information technology systems necessary for the collection, evaluation, and analysis of such data.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3785602F18804418BC14A454E024A906"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Loan and grant terms and conditions
               Amounts made available under this section shall be for direct loans, grants, and direct loans that can be converted to grants to eligible recipients that agree to an extended period of affordability for the property.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H01F84BC66E784E489677EAA9C3753B7E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Definitions
               As used in this section—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H144E7547ED6D4E61B41628AADFB5A2D2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">eligible recipient means any owner or sponsor of an eligible property; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1F4AE2AF870843EAACD1756A63D10566"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">eligible property means a property assisted pursuant to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3A36AAA0591F42DA8950CA15ABB53EF9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     section 202 of the Housing Act of 1959 (12 U.S.C. 1701q);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6728BBC5A7914FCB93B53EBF6086F6DE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     section 202 of the Housing Act of 1959 (former 12 U.S.C. 1701q), as such section existed before the enactment of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9F551B9BFFCD45FCA88F752844B0BF6E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     section 811 of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act (42 U.S.C. 8013);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBF6DC1F4AE78441DB189EAE9883AF507"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     section 8(b) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437f(b));
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4AF866EED9374FDE8553033F15857BB7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     section 236 of the National Housing Act (12 U.S.C. 1715z–1); or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC946F73138B841F2AA3EA4DEE61DF7EB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     a Housing Assistance Payments contract for Project-Based Rental Assistance in fiscal year 2021.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H39EB1F83F9734C679955953EBF781FD2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Waiver
               The Secretary may waive or specify alternative requirements for any provision of subsection (c) or (bb) of section 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437f(c), 1437f(bb)) upon a finding that the waiver or alternative requirement is necessary to facilitate the use of amounts made available under this section.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7787412D150E493EBA107E2FCF6F2D2B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Implementation
               The Secretary shall have the authority to establish by notice any requirements that the Secretary determines are necessary for timely and effective implementation of the program and expenditure of funds appropriated, which requirements shall take effect upon issuance. 
            
         
      
      <title id="H61F3766C66F147F4A7362C828770042F"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         IV
         COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE, SCIENCE, AND TRANSPORTATION
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE5C85D0FAFA24036B99EEE8CA4DBBE47"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40001.
            INVESTING IN COASTAL COMMUNITIES AND CLIMATE RESILIENCE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE74ABE480AA84727AEFE70FEB771AAC1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,600,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to provide funding through direct expenditure, contracts, grants, cooperative agreements, or technical assistance to coastal states (as defined in paragraph (4) of section 304 of the Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 (16 U.S.C. 1453(4))), the District of Columbia, Tribal Governments, nonprofit organizations, local governments, and institutions of higher education (as defined in subsection (a) of section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001(a))), for the conservation, restoration, and protection of coastal and marine habitats, resources, Pacific salmon and other marine fisheries, to enable coastal communities to prepare for extreme storms and other changing climate conditions, and for projects that support natural resources that sustain coastal and marine resource dependent communities, marine fishery and marine mammal stock assessments, and for related administrative expenses. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HDBA8CD06853241578A38FEB5203A8B7F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Tribal government defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Tribal Government means the recognized governing body of any Indian or Alaska Native tribe, band, nation, pueblo, village, community, component band, or component reservation, individually identified (including parenthetically) in the list published most recently as of the date of enactment of this subsection pursuant to section 104 of the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 5131). 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0C2C38B2BD2F49189B80F921C59F48DC"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40002.
            FACILITIES OF THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION AND NATIONAL MARINE SANCTUARIES
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC9D5F1E7722C4180A0221F1FB0983786"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               National oceanic and atmospheric administration facilities
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for the construction of new facilities, facilities in need of replacement, piers, marine operations facilities, and fisheries laboratories. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0144E7A6D0A74D52A66CE27912C1A2BA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               National marine sanctuaries facilities
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $50,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for the construction of facilities to support the National Marine Sanctuary System established under subsection (c) of section 301 of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act (16 U.S.C. 1431(c)). 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H22F8798142FC4342A99F152075234B68"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40003.
            NOAA EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE REVIEWS
             In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $20,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to conduct more efficient, accurate, and timely reviews for planning, permitting and approval processes through the hiring and training of personnel, and the purchase of technical and scientific services and new equipment, and to improve agency transparency, accountability, and public engagement.
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9C2D060845EF41139FD658D1D9AF21A9"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40004.
            OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC RESEARCH AND FORECASTING FOR WEATHER AND CLIMATE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7493AC69A03441FA83B7411D79DE1929"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Forecasting and research
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to accelerate advances and improvements in research, observation systems, modeling, forecasting, assessments, and dissemination of information to the public as it pertains to ocean and atmospheric processes related to weather, coasts, oceans, and climate, and to carry out section 102(a) of the Weather Research and Forecasting Innovation Act of 2017 (15 U.S.C. 8512(a)), and for related administrative expenses. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H21E9C031CC7B414A83F971EF8E0F27F2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Research grants and science information, products, and services
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2026, $50,000,000 for competitive grants to fund climate research as it relates to weather, ocean, coastal, and atmospheric processes and conditions, and impacts to marine species and coastal habitat, and for related administrative expenses.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HFF5F78C5343248BD890868BD36FA51AE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40005.
            COMPUTING CAPACITY AND RESEARCH FOR WEATHER, OCEANS, AND CLIMATE
             In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $190,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for the procurement of additional high-performance computing, data processing capacity, data management, and storage assets, to carry out section 204(a)(2) of the High-Performance Computing Act of 1991 (15 U.S.C. 5524(a)(2)), and for transaction agreements authorized under section 301(d)(1)(A) of the Weather Research and Forecasting Innovation Act of 2017 (15 U.S.C. 8531(d)(1)(A)), and for related administrative expenses. 
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H6CEE12123A5142E8966A565A5BF11174"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40006.
            ACQUISITION OF HURRICANE FORECASTING AIRCRAFT
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for the acquisition of hurricane hunter aircraft under section 413(a) of the Weather Research and Forecasting Innovation Act of 2017 (15 U.S.C. 8549(a)). 
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H3A68AFF65A714B62B9B089E7923F2508"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            40007.
            ALTERNATIVE FUEL AND LOW-EMISSION AVIATION TECHNOLOGY PROGRAM
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H646B648D51A745C7AF2D54DB474259CC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Appropriation and establishment
               For purposes of establishing a competitive grant program for eligible entities to carry out projects located in the United States that produce, transport, blend, or store sustainable aviation fuel, or develop, demonstrate, or apply low-emission aviation technologies, in addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2026—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1EB6ED4DF72F4EC79E00B41BA8E99DB7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  $244,530,000 for projects relating to the production, transportation, blending, or storage of sustainable aviation fuel;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H785CC71054624872A4586D3A402260ED"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  $46,530,000 for projects relating to low-emission aviation technologies; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H31EF29C665664447ADF5A05A6989D787"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  $5,940,000 to fund the award of grants under this section, and oversight of the program, by the Secretary.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE6AF17FFC42046A799B43AFFC2D30E69"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Considerations
               In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary shall consider, with respect to a proposed project—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE63BED3005AF47EABB8C17D718CFC51A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the capacity for the eligible entity to increase the domestic production and deployment of sustainable aviation fuel or the use of low-emission aviation technologies among the United States commercial aviation and aerospace industry;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF163275492C64D5E97D6B13FACD9C95C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the projected greenhouse gas emissions from such project, including emissions resulting from the development of the project, and the potential the project has to reduce or displace, on a lifecycle basis, United States greenhouse gas emissions associated with air travel;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9EA8E7241FAB46A4989E0B051BAAE8BA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  the capacity to create new jobs and develop supply chain partnerships in the United States;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H00B470A729A44912AEC90B1B3A5966D1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  for projects related to the production of sustainable aviation fuel, the projected lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions benefits from the proposed project, which shall include feedstock and fuel production and potential direct and indirect greenhouse gas emissions (including resulting from changes in land use); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBFF46CD11F4647C994900A267C8C56B6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  the benefits of ensuring a diversity of feedstocks for sustainable aviation fuel, including the use of waste carbon oxides and direct air capture.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H82E30C5F008E41A38DBFA68C2E24A5AB"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Cost share
               The Federal share of the cost of a project carried out using grant funds under subsection (a) shall be 75 percent of the total proposed cost of the project, except that such Federal share shall increase to 90 percent of the total proposed cost of the project if the eligible entity is a small hub airport or nonhub airport, as such terms are defined in section 47102 of title 49, United States Code. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0662D5FBC13940B7B492E5445A229DA8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Fuel emissions reduction test
               For purposes of clause (ii) of subsection (e)(7)(E), the Secretary shall, not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this section, adopt at least 1 methodology for testing lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions that meets the requirements of such clause.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7777B24164064AF68382640EF5937BBD"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Definitions
               In this section:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFC284D35E9324D0E81F50EABFA48CB5A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Eligible entity
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">eligible entity means—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2750C7D4467F4FF9AFE3C632A317DE63"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     a State or local government, including the District of Columbia, other than an airport sponsor;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H275A9A1A039E4D3F85F2E9398EE76A5A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     an air carrier;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF4EEF14921E047A4A7EF963704138DAE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     an airport sponsor;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD8B86A44DD3A40278B3760EDF81711FE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     an accredited institution of higher education;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCCDE92748CC048C98ADAA596A5D19D56"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     a research institution;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H82D5909D97E14EC188CC37DD872EFB96"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     a person or entity engaged in the production, transportation, blending, or storage of sustainable aviation fuel in the United States or feedstocks in the United States that could be used to produce sustainable aviation fuel;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7E44B8FCD4BC4C59817B1B836977729D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     a person or entity engaged in the development, demonstration, or application of low-emission aviation technologies; or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAAFBD895CB7943F18271C86EBBDAAC3C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     nonprofit entities or nonprofit consortia with experience in sustainable aviation fuels, low-emission aviation technologies, or other clean transportation research programs.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H48918105476545D28E37FEA27328CBA8"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Feedstock
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">feedstock means sources of hydrogen and carbon not originating from unrefined or refined petrochemicals.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7C109233F9374F9992A4271FBC57A700"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Induced land-use change values
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">induced land-use change values means the greenhouse gas emissions resulting from the conversion of land to the production of feedstocks and from the conversion of other land due to the displacement of crops or animals for which the original land was previously used.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC0190C6780C442278EF892D200E02F29"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions means the combined greenhouse gas emissions from feedstock production, collection of feedstock, transportation of feedstock to fuel production facilities, conversion of feedstock to fuel, transportation and distribution of fuel, and fuel combustion in an aircraft engine, as well as from induced land-use change values.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0641CF2E0FFB4EDE80E43F917AA85D60"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Low-emission aviation technologies
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">low-emission aviation technologies means technologies, produced in the United States, that significantly—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4006C39E7A6C4C7A9EA7525DBFB75412"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     improve aircraft fuel efficiency;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H91E5B3179A3943EB8D405F86618C5349"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     increase utilization of sustainable aviation fuel; or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2D3FB16753E4A66B3A9FD8A705B9EFC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     reduce greenhouse gas emissions produced during operation of civil aircraft.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7390B2A440A444418AE119B151950B47"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Secretary
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Secretary means the Secretary of Transportation.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBCB7946D2CEF403B94C7AED3100A0854"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  Sustainable aviation fuel
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">sustainable aviation fuel means liquid fuel, produced in the United States, that—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF3C2EACF45E24AF88A0108717032983B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     consists of synthesized hydrocarbons;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCD40E05671FC46DC8C9D12C135F5822A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     meets the requirements of—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8CC98167EF2D4B98A430D0D756E9F790"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        ASTM International Standard D7566; or
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5BE7E3086CBB48A095DCACC3EF285710"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        the co-processing provisions of ASTM International Standard D1655, Annex A1 (or such successor standard);
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H71B5BBFBFFEC4B378E66E15D827E0D7B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     is derived from biomass (in a similar manner as such term is defined in section 45K(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986), waste streams, renewable energy sources, or gaseous carbon oxides;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1E9ACC2C512B428CA5478325C007EAC9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     is not derived from palm fatty acid distillates; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB09A6D397BC3485A914B608234BC5BD7"
