                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     achieves at least a 50 percent lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions reduction in comparison with petroleum-based jet fuel, as determined by a test that shows—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3D87DDC4ECCF4C4EB99E5460574FDDA0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        the fuel production pathway achieves at least a 50 percent reduction of the aggregate attributional core lifecycle emissions and the induced land-use change values under a lifecycle methodology for sustainable aviation fuels similar to that adopted by the International Civil Aviation Organization with the agreement of the United States; or
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1BC561AADBAC4AB89DEF0A8723B1AD72"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        the fuel production pathway achieves at least a 50 percent reduction of the aggregate attributional core lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions values and the induced land-use change values under another methodology that the Secretary determines is—
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H83C9402BF3B24A62891D0E0D180BB01B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (I)
                           reflective of the latest scientific understanding of lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions; and
                        
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H56C5E9C140734834A25172CACB2E1F38"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (II)
                           as stringent as the requirement under clause (i). 
                        
                     
                  
               
            
         
      
      <title id="H957EE9DD3C394D6D99EBEABD7F16B946"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         V
         COMMITTEE ON ENERGY AND NATURAL RESOURCES
         <subtitle id="HE73CE6CE5ECE4106B3BAD7141660A14B"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            A
            Energy
            
               1
               General provisions
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9704C537DA944E1CA0DAD7A9C6CC20A3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50111.
                  DEFINITIONS
                  In this subtitle:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA9DDF9DDE03542CEAB35762719F4BAA6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Greenhouse gas
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">greenhouse gas has the meaning given the term in section 1610(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 (42 U.S.C. 13389(a)). 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2582BAA031EE4B6DA94068D946E1414E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Secretary
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Secretary means the Secretary of Energy.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H213051DEB5284B3F9F196CAEE51C963D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     State
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">State means a State, the District of Columbia, and a United States Insular Area (as that term is defined in section 50211).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFDF52EA69AB1489887D228617E374FF5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     State energy office
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">State energy office has the meaning given the term in section 124(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 15821(a)).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H095F23A28957473D83DC3496741C4FA0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     State energy program
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">State Energy Program means the State Energy Program established pursuant to part D of title III of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6321 through 6326).
                  
               
            
            
               2
               Residential efficiency and electrification rebates
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H36B8CFC5DF524EEFAE7058A1AE4F5CD1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50121.
                  HOME ENERGY PERFORMANCE-BASED, WHOLE-HOUSE REBATES
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9678E2C9532C4C1FB665D86F28854BCF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H14F78B9291B946BDB81A9DBECEEDBFD2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $4,300,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to carry out a program to award grants to State energy offices to develop and implement a HOMES rebate program.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H953BA734175B4DACB4729EBDBBA59690"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Allocation of funds
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA1C8297F91134505BB85A2D61F84FB11"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           The Secretary shall reserve funds made available under paragraph (1) for each State energy office—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBBAD36CC64FB40128E71CAA8D153B43C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in accordance with the allocation formula for the State Energy Program in effect on January 1, 2022; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0B103EB3086B41F4876390910663778E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              to be distributed to a State energy office if the application of the State energy office under subsection (b) is approved.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB2DA7822562346DEA198601DEF709705"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Additional funds
                           Not earlier than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, any money reserved under subparagraph (A) but not distributed under clause (ii) of that subparagraph shall be redistributed to the State energy offices operating a HOMES rebate program using a grant received under this section in proportion to the amount distributed to those State energy offices under subparagraph (A)(ii).
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H373E7E0F15A54AAE8CA464CA0C91CC0C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Administrative expenses
                        Of the funds made available under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall use not more than 3 percent for—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC910DE430BCA45EAB00C4C02B9F83B8D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           administrative purposes; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H32EA24917101418D9BA4DEF004B33E8B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           providing technical assistance relating to activities carried out under this section. 
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9BF9C8BF57AE4F52B87D240EFBB4A228"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Application
                     A State energy office seeking a grant under this section shall submit to the Secretary an application that includes a plan to implement a HOMES rebate program, including a plan—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF84F9EE4FE1E4C11B6E28AD553CA4A97"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to use procedures, as approved by the Secretary, for determining the reductions in home energy use resulting from the implementation of a home energy efficiency retrofit that are calibrated to historical energy usage for a home consistent with BPI 2400, for purposes of modeled performance home rebates;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB45B7B780FF74A4990CEB47D5433DABB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to use open-source advanced measurement and verification software, as approved by the Secretary, for determining and documenting the monthly and hourly (if available) weather-normalized energy use of a home before and after the implementation of a home energy efficiency retrofit, for purposes of measured performance home rebates;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9CA5BCAAD96345AB8984C81F35514E49"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        to value savings based on time, location, or greenhouse gas emissions; 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC40F5DC79FE24067A8FB15C8AD84E0AE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        for quality monitoring to ensure that each home energy efficiency retrofit for which a rebate is provided is documented in a certificate that—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2818A7DC392A4FEBB84F5157169F1861"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           is provided by the contractor and certified by a third party to the homeowner; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0769331D304A443F86ED62103C3E57AB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           details the work performed, the equipment and materials installed, and the projected energy savings or energy generation to support accurate valuation of the retrofit; 
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H34DA3318C3584DC8922C50EA2FD72B94"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        to provide a contractor performing a home energy efficiency retrofit or an aggregator who has the right to claim a rebate $200 for each home located in a disadvantaged community that receives a home energy efficiency retrofit for which a rebate is provided under the program; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H741B925D6016474F8F9951CF5FD73B30"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        to ensure that a homeowner or aggregator does not receive a rebate for the same upgrade through both a HOMES rebate program and any other Federal grant or rebate program, pursuant to subsection (c)(7). 
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HAA35BC0017F04EDA8D680C5E19048B5D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     HOMES rebate program
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC5E0C86130ED4A3DA73651AE6D1314D6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        A HOMES rebate program carried out by a State energy office receiving a grant pursuant to this section shall provide rebates to homeowners and aggregators for whole-house energy saving retrofits begun on or after the date of enactment of this Act and completed by not later than September 30, 2031.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEFAF80E144AF4B3583456C6B72A416D8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Amount of rebate
                        Subject to paragraph (3), under a HOMES rebate program, the amount of a rebate shall not exceed—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9A3DA266A2634A3BA9DC0BB4A55F348F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           for individuals and aggregators carrying out energy efficiency upgrades of single-family homes—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9345C66EE9A64BC78E5419DF40970499"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 20 percent but less than 35 percent, the lesser of—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H291EA4F5BCA84403A1861B44E405B622"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 $2,000; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA45DDEE285814991A68B40460DACA3F6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 50 percent of the project cost;
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFC214786D23C46C7B3729E589A44FA39"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 35 percent, the lesser of—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA7D4AB8648464465A1CB6C6325DEC9A3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 $4,000; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAAC09F56DCE54986AFD8559F472B9992"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 50 percent of the project cost; and
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE468CA8299FF45CDA7CE5B261B592775"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              for measured energy savings, in the case of a home or portfolio of homes that achieves energy savings of not less than 15 percent—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC7A2DC33390E46C4893D09FBD8DB4F10"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 a payment rate per kilowatt hour saved, or kilowatt hour-equivalent saved, equal to $2,000 for a 20 percent reduction of energy use for the average home in the State; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBF77F3B56BD44696B724B859708BF0FB"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 50 percent of the project cost;
                              
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H916D3758628848FB8B7F310E40D2E6A7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           for multifamily building owners and aggregators carrying out energy efficiency upgrades of multifamily buildings—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H700DC943579945EDAC74C95557CD9960"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 20 percent but less than 35 percent, $2,000 per dwelling unit, with a maximum of $200,000 per multifamily building;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCC7FB059486047EEA084142BDFE3F97D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 35 percent, $4,000 per dwelling unit, with a maximum of $400,000 per multifamily building; or
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H99A0320394024AE4BEBD9C9B4E205DD0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              for measured energy savings, in the case of a multifamily building or portfolio of multifamily buildings that achieves energy savings of not less than 15 percent—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H638EB6FE96034FE3A7D59CD3C2111C32"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 a payment rate per kilowatt hour saved, or kilowatt hour-equivalent saved, equal to $2,000 for a 20 percent reduction of energy use per dwelling unit for the average multifamily building in the State; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H55550482548842938A440B2DE5C09199"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 50 percent of the project cost; and
                              
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE734EABE50B24212AC96BB53F777C6E8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           for individuals and aggregators carrying out energy efficiency upgrades of a single-family home occupied by a low- or moderate-income household or a multifamily building not less than 50 percent of the dwelling units of which are occupied by low- or moderate-income households—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6722F39E96464A28A9314DE57F10802B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 20 percent but less than 35 percent, the lesser of—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4F3B304AE8E8400AB27790BA1043DE05"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 $4,000 per single-family home or dwelling unit; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2C670ACEE2DB4359BF654679E3202353"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 80 percent of the project cost;
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H373A55ED6C3E40738381B12B6048BF56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              in the case of a retrofit that achieves modeled energy system savings of not less than 35 percent, the lesser of—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD8DE98064B9B48E0A4F66A566D2420F2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 $8,000 per single-family home or dwelling unit; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE460FB1FC68B48D1AAF538ADBDE51C7C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 80 percent of the project cost; and
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD88B946C24B34631AB062E598C267406"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              for measured energy savings, in the case of a single-family home, multifamily building, or portfolio of single-family homes or multifamily buildings that achieves energy savings of not less than 15 percent—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9FBA1F1BF1C940889E94A3E3B9EA05D3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 a payment rate per kilowatt hour saved, or kilowatt hour-equivalent saved, equal to $4,000 for a 20 percent reduction of energy use per single-family home or dwelling unit, as applicable, for the average single-family home or multifamily building in the State; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0B2E9F6ACF2B4807B7F01705043B1027"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 80 percent of the project cost.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9BEE07C60E394B45933F7D2DA18FF7FD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Rebates to low- or moderate-income households
                        On approval from the Secretary, notwithstanding paragraph (2), a State energy office carrying out a HOMES rebate program using a grant awarded pursuant to this section may increase rebate amounts for low- or moderate-income households.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAFFC2663BD474144B693832A3A74C647"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Use of funds
                        A State energy office that receives a grant pursuant to this section may use not more than 20 percent of the grant amount for planning, administration, or technical assistance related to a HOMES rebate program.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9FFBE7DFCDB141F2B4546EF0A2BEF5E2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        Data access guidelines
                        The Secretary shall develop and publish guidelines for States relating to residential electric and natural gas energy data sharing.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1D190573EDBA448E9E62271717EB302E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        Exemption
                        Activities carried out by a State energy office using a grant awarded pursuant to this section shall not be subject to the expenditure prohibitions and limitations described in section 420.18 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H87AD9CA8F4FC49F6B563A091F93AE4B9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (7)
                        Prohibition on combining rebates
                        A rebate provided by a State energy office under a HOMES rebate program may not be combined with any other Federal grant or rebate, including a rebate provided under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program (as defined in section 50122(d)), for the same single upgrade. 
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB9D3D12A602E4A2F881BC22816228004"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3B56663BBAB24D7A8085BA118A8E1724"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Disadvantaged community
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">disadvantaged community means a community that the Secretary determines, based on appropriate data, indices, and screening tools, is economically, socially, or environmentally disadvantaged.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7AAC0C52DD144F41937835860DA96C25"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        HOMES rebate program
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">HOMES rebate program means a Home Owner Managing Energy Savings rebate program established by a State energy office as part of an approved State energy conservation plan under the State Energy Program.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H741D247E41374BD6987932592E439F1B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Low- or moderate-income household
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">low- or moderate-income household means an individual or family the total annual income of which is less than 80 percent of the median income of the area in which the individual or family resides, as reported by the Department of Housing and Urban Development, including an individual or family that has demonstrated eligibility for another Federal program with income restrictions equal to or below 80 percent of area median income. 
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H496F32E5957841FB9F593532B765C79B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50122.
                  HIGH-EFFICIENCY ELECTRIC HOME REBATE PROGRAM
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4508F584B2224D98952B4ED2DB581CE8"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriations
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4982D76B4F50452AB8DFC04887EE2750"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Funds to state energy offices and indian tribes
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to carry out a program—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCDD7A44EAA2F47FCA310786F7494581F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           to award grants to State energy offices to develop and implement a high-efficiency electric home rebate program in accordance with subsection (c), $4,275,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H448C81F7373647028ED008BEA14FDD1D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           to award grants to Indian Tribes to develop and implement a high-efficiency electric home rebate program in accordance with subsection (c), $225,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H09D1C65DFAAD4281BCE983ED5385F0B7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Allocation of funds
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H55D1C110CF2045C68160C0AB5E38B4F6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           State energy offices
                           The Secretary shall reserve funds made available under paragraph (1)(A) for each State energy office—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H65154440832443E6B392B2CE06467045"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in accordance with the allocation formula for the State Energy Program in effect on January 1, 2022; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H39D33D5D80B04C6ABD7BBFCAE8E6C089"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              to be distributed to a State energy office if the application of the State energy office under subsection (b) is approved.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H03FF5D14FBD441C386AD67AE92FD9440"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Indian tribes
                           The Secretary shall reserve funds made available under paragraph (1)(B)—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HABEF7ECD50A24F79AABC3753154A2FC3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              in a manner determined appropriate by the Secretary; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB5975902F20F4DFF87568CBCBE2329D4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              to be distributed to an Indian Tribe if the application of the Indian Tribe under subsection (b) is approved.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H878C5E44AEB74CD4B27FCAA0058F3531"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Additional funds
                           Not earlier than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, any money reserved under—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5593F8DAEAEF4D0BA2458C58F3F8515D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              subparagraph (A) but not distributed under clause (ii) of that subparagraph shall be redistributed to the State energy offices operating a high-efficiency electric home rebate program in proportion to the amount distributed to those State energy offices under that clause; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF497F4A7CFD646828E3855F7C69B1C37"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              subparagraph (B) but not distributed under clause (ii) of that subparagraph shall be redistributed to the Indian Tribes operating a high-efficiency electric home rebate program in proportion to the amount distributed to those Indian Tribes under that clause.
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7847D73B03DC419CB9E6BAB866A29D57"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Administrative expenses
                        Of the funds made available under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall use not more than 3 percent for—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEA996F31A8BD4DC2A9808E70C963C803"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           administrative purposes; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7FB0C3AEDE504A84A329342F57F59FF9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           providing technical assistance relating to activities carried out under this section.
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HFC304BB1B5684A1CBFC320AAFB28FEF4"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Application
                     A State energy office or Indian Tribe seeking a grant under the program shall submit to the Secretary an application that includes a plan to implement a high-efficiency electric home rebate program, including—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H61D1B5C377DC45C683F83950FD3BF6BA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        a plan to verify the income eligibility of eligible entities seeking a rebate for a qualified electrification project;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6B708A053E9042F99071DAAC7E37F1A7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        a plan to allow rebates for qualified electrification projects at the point of sale in a manner that ensures that the income eligibility of an eligible entity seeking a rebate may be verified at the point of sale;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H35EB1660A301476987EF20D388B2A0FE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        a plan to ensure that an eligible entity does not receive a rebate for the same qualified electrification project through both a high-efficiency electric home rebate program and any other Federal grant or rebate program, pursuant to subsection (c)(8); and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC4F6480D01554BA5A600495BA2B413A4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        any additional information that the Secretary may require.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4D43FABFB4F9495C8A601D9A2C780ADC"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     High-efficiency electric home rebate program
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H54BA14B39CC0423BB17470A828E08750"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        Under the program, the Secretary shall award grants to State energy offices and Indian Tribes to establish a high-efficiency electric home rebate program under which rebates shall be provided to eligible entities for qualified electrification projects.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7A29A95AFBD34B37A4E02FCAD5580704"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Guidelines
                        The Secretary shall prescribe guidelines for high-efficiency electric home rebate programs, including guidelines for providing point of sale rebates in a manner consistent with the income eligibility requirements under this section. 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB21167EB81B04007A46757738E7278A9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Amount of rebate
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0E4AD8A46BB741DDBBDC406F1B5E7260"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           Appliance upgrades
                           The amount of a rebate provided under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program for the purchase of an appliance under a qualified electrification project shall be—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H759EF5724EA3471FAD6F062460C36059"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              not more than $1,750 for a heat pump water heater;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H64B157D3852444AD8B65C769C6A3B543"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              not more than $8,000 for a heat pump for space heating or cooling; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H52CD5762C39E4D07ACFC898D20FC8E1A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              not more than $840 for—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD1A15059DE96459DB10619E3B487FBD6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 an electric stove, cooktop, range, or oven; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H939B23BF855F409D9B44DD04E542B0E4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 an electric heat pump clothes dryer.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7685CFF5663F4AC98FDC0ECB6611E04B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Nonappliance upgrades
                           The amount of a rebate provided under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program for the purchase of a nonappliance upgrade under a qualified electrification project shall be—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H33774BAA2C644B7A8319EE455F33BF2E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              not more than $4,000 for an electric load service center upgrade;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6709DD264C0741F4BEE9411840B52CAC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              not more than $1,600 for insulation, air sealing, and ventilation; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5B7AD8F088B84551AFE0562FF178BA07"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              not more than $2,500 for electric wiring.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE485A984052D42F691E75A0AD6C74049"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Maximum rebate
                           An eligible entity receiving multiple rebates under this section may receive not more than a total of $14,000 in rebates.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1A9FC091A46848249B98721D1229B14C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Limitations
                        A rebate provided using funding under this section shall not exceed—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H19DFB78EA65D4E6295C95D2911517F93"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           in the case of an eligible entity described in subsection (d)(1)(A)—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCBAA600F944147A796FDA4F5BDC17A61"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              50 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a household the annual income of which is not less than 80 percent and not greater than 150 percent of the area median income; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFDC30263DAF74BE5875F1C352ADA6C8D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              100 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a household the annual income of which is less than 80 percent of the area median income;
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD721342A7D1C49F6A1EF4596D92B20EC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           in the case of an eligible entity described in subsection (d)(1)(B)—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H90DE5393E62141D08F4A3FCE00C33D7B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              50 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a multifamily building not less than 50 percent of the residents of which are households the annual income of which is not less than 80 percent and not greater than 150 percent of the area median income; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5B4E5FCC7CD94A628B730658FF6EF5FB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              100 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a multifamily building not less than 50 percent of the residents of which are households the annual income of which is less than 80 percent of the area median income; or
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA4D6B9E01F4C4D629CFD0C88AEF1E430"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           in the case of an eligible entity described in subsection (d)(1)(C)—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8B69DDBFD02447F3983EC9EFA86076A4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              50 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a household—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H879CAFD860D64AF5BB251E394F3FDCFD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 on behalf of which the eligible entity is working; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB2B36A9E2EBA42D3984A90FD93DDF7D6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 the annual income of which is not less than 80 percent and not greater than 150 percent of the area median income; and
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3B8D61816E0B4DDA972406CA0A0F2C9D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              100 percent of the cost of the qualified electrification project for a household—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H22BD0CFC683442D1B832E976A82F5329"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 on behalf of which the eligible entity is working; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H13814AFD97454A01BF8C9F3A44AB6981"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 the annual income of which is less than 80 percent of the area median income.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8CFC7651E7C14E9894EDDC6E4FDCF494"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        Amount for installation of upgrades
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD7B7D8B38C624458B07CF2E0467C86D1"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           In the case of an eligible entity described in subsection (d)(1)(C) that receives a rebate under the program and performs the installation of the applicable qualified electrification project, a State energy office or Indian Tribe shall provide to that eligible entity, in addition to the rebate, an amount that—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H82E3C77DB40442AB8FADE192A7EE8435"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              does not exceed $500; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFC0D8451D8384C6E8227BD83120B5B71"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              is commensurate with the scale of the upgrades installed as part of the qualified electrification project, as determined by the Secretary.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDB02357C8DD9485B9BB047204A1CD01E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Treatment
                           An amount received under subparagraph (A) by an eligible entity described in that subparagraph shall not be subject to the requirement under paragraph (6).
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4F70ADC7A0B3452B9762A90B9F7EEE6A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        Requirement
                        An eligible entity described in subparagraph (C) of subsection (d)(1) shall discount the amount of a rebate received for a qualified electrification project from any amount charged by that eligible entity to the eligible entity described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of that subsection on behalf of which the qualified electrification project is carried out.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H941889DFD0B5417DAD912E3D6C9E39B3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (7)
                        Exemption
                        Activities carried out by a State energy office using a grant provided under the program shall not be subject to the expenditure prohibitions and limitations described in section 420.18 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEB3B63DECC8F493C9F0DB75CC30B5CF5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (8)
                        Prohibition on combining rebates
                        A rebate provided by a State energy office or Indian Tribe under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program may not be combined with any other Federal grant or rebate, including a rebate provided under a HOMES rebate program (as defined in section 50121(d)), for the same qualified electrification project.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6AFC2FC92C544B60BEF99B06DA2464E4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (9)
                        Administrative costs
                        A State energy office or Indian Tribe that receives a grant under the program shall use not more than 20 percent of the grant amount for planning, administration, or technical assistance relating to a high-efficiency electric home rebate program.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4BA1401DA690476CB1558F5D19BC6BA0"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H213CA1661388461EBA4C2F8D7E086224"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Eligible entity
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">eligible entity means—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H39F273C83AB94901BC4D54D6ADBBFCBC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           a low- or moderate-income household;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H071E0B20D4D0457581A2EB7DDDB58139"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           an individual or entity that owns a multifamily building not less than 50 percent of the residents of which are low- or moderate-income households; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD36FF4F1FAE94CB3AA84E71F3AACD3D6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           a governmental, commercial, or nonprofit entity, as determined by the Secretary, carrying out a qualified electrification project on behalf of an entity described in subparagraph (A) or (B).
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H261B3C7E5E6D402F823FDB13BD09E316"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        High-efficiency electric home rebate program
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">high-efficiency electric home rebate program means a rebate program carried out by a State energy office or Indian Tribe pursuant to subsection (c) using a grant received under the program. 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB0945C0B40904674AEAC1495219FA8BA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Indian Tribe
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Indian Tribe has the meaning given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H88113AFADB4C42318BECECB1B955F6C5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Low- or moderate-income household
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">low- or moderate-income household means an individual or family the total annual income of which is less than 150 percent of the median income of the area in which the individual or family resides, as reported by the Department of Housing and Urban Development, including an individual or family that has demonstrated eligibility for another Federal program with income restrictions equal to or below 150 percent of area median income. 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H55190DCD24B84EFFA1E888434CEACCCE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        Program
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">program means the program carried out by the Secretary under subsection (a)(1).
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5771D68E5EAC4B3288B7D691DED22624"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        Qualified electrification project
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4ADE7BE8F1864170A45667F853DDA0C4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">qualified electrification project means a project that—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H589A12685EF24E70B789CFA0E1B95C2C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              includes the purchase and installation of—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBB0C67A716BA4E46BB45699690A9EA22"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 an electric heat pump water heater;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H92DD746DE3D24753823F1A49F9AF80F4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 an electric heat pump for space heating and cooling;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9E77E3C40884475293FE1D1524AB72F5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 an electric stove, cooktop, range, or oven;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEE463D8788C946A488B0588D478A605B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (IV)
                                 an electric heat pump clothes dryer;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4D75EEAC2B654E90A01C95FE89403236"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (V)
                                 an electric load service center;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0A6E6FB578784896BBC7EF63F1295B90"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VI)
                                 insulation;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4002570311DE4BCF9FDC5073F1A9688C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VII)
                                 air sealing and materials to improve ventilation; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBCD2BD70DD1D43329A55E47EB8C2C82A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VIII)
                                 electric wiring;
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4577A928FEE24EFEA3FA4630334349D5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              with respect to any appliance described in clause (i), the purchase of which is carried out—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7FBAB3FA86EA44F8B16F55F94B4D4C57"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 as part of new construction;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H883CA072738B466786513D5125A96048"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 to replace a nonelectric appliance; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD206425DE283492684C6DC33F3B03D24"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 as a first-time purchase with respect to that appliance; and
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE392D61A83E54FDBB506EE036631BFA3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              is carried out at, or relating to, a single-family home or multifamily building, as applicable and defined by the Secretary.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2CF0408115BE418094D91D875C0B47B6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Exclusions
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">qualified electrification project does not include any project with respect to which the appliance, system, equipment, infrastructure, component, or other item described in subclauses (I) through (VIII) of subparagraph (A)(i) is not certified under the Energy Star program established by section 324A of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6294a), if applicable.
                        
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H5EC19BF0D9B54284A2D5A0F235FFAEAE"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50123.
                  STATE-BASED HOME ENERGY EFFICIENCY CONTRACTOR TRAINING GRANTS
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H16589F3AB5704C9A9685CE7AA8515B1F"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $200,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to carry out a program to provide financial assistance to States to develop and implement a State program described in section 362(d)(13) of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6322(d)(13)), which shall provide training and education to contractors involved in the installation of home energy efficiency and electrification improvements, including improvements eligible for rebates under a HOMES rebate program (as defined in section 50121(d)) or a high-efficiency electric home rebate program (as defined in section 50122(d)), as part of an approved State energy conservation plan under the State Energy Program.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC11D35AB525F488080BD8A2F0F9A790F"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Use of funds
                     A State may use amounts received under subsection (a)—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8E3202BC31974B2290362DAA6C1DE197"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to reduce the cost of training contractor employees;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBEABA673CF1E4B7D92AD4C0ACEAF9A85"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to provide testing and certification of contractors trained and educated under a State program developed and implemented pursuant to subsection (a); and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAD27B7C7495C4E00817BD4E708863990"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        to partner with nonprofit organizations to develop and implement a State program pursuant to subsection (a).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H2151C7B085204B3885598CFAFFD87C77"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Administrative expenses
                     Of the amounts received by a State under subsection (a), a State shall use not more than 10 percent for administrative expenses associated with developing and implementing a State program pursuant to that subsection.
                  
               
            
            
               3
               Building efficiency and resilience
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H43B594C1893F4EA7AD887C0D16CB1BEC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50131.
                  ASSISTANCE FOR LATEST AND ZERO BUILDING ENERGY CODE ADOPTION
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5DE18E7D01E74532A8B3295BD89FC983"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD8B28D3FA6BC416FA715A30AB43CF572"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        $330,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2029, to carry out activities under part D of title III of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6321 through 6326) in accordance with subsection (b); and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H84C55D871AA840FE8C873444CE24E876"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        $670,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2029, to carry out activities under part D of title III of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6321 through 6326) in accordance with subsection (c).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H308D5550D1D34D388EF0E8326D72A5E1"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Latest building energy code
                     The Secretary shall use funds made available under subsection (a)(1) for grants to assist States, and units of local government that have authority to adopt building codes—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H14F4C5A07867448C8E3FFD6F5A14A3AA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to adopt—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2DB61FDB772A46C5901754F0577A6D4E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           a building energy code (or codes) for residential buildings that meets or exceeds the 2021 International Energy Conservation Code, or achieves equivalent or greater energy savings;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2FD360710C6D4C799926405898697CAB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           a building energy code (or codes) for commercial buildings that meets or exceeds the ANSI/ASHRAE/IES Standard 90.1–2019, or achieves equivalent or greater energy savings; or
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H114813CCD138408D8E2FF27A89F160D8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           any combination of building energy codes described in subparagraph (A) or (B); and
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H680861B7A60B482B99F7DB8D4BD6E2A1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to implement a plan for the jurisdiction to achieve full compliance with any building energy code adopted under paragraph (1) in new and renovated residential or commercial buildings, as applicable, which plan shall include active training and enforcement programs and measurement of the rate of compliance each year.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB7AAC41248014AD6A516113C7A26B834"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Zero energy code
                     The Secretary shall use funds made available under subsection (a)(2) for grants to assist States, and units of local government that have authority to adopt building codes—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H323E0897D40B4391879515E587545C79"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to adopt a building energy code (or codes) for residential and commercial buildings that meets or exceeds the zero energy provisions in the 2021 International Energy Conservation Code or an equivalent stretch code; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD47F86E1F86B458F9620411998232BFC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to implement a plan for the jurisdiction to achieve full compliance with any building energy code adopted under paragraph (1) in new and renovated residential and commercial buildings, which plan shall include active training and enforcement programs and measurement of the rate of compliance each year.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H392997A4FDFE4E94AD192AF53EE9DDCB"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
