                     (d)
                     State match
                     The State cost share requirement under the item relating to <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Department of Energy—Energy Conservation in title II of the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1985 (42 U.S.C. 6323a; 98 Stat. 1861), shall not apply to assistance provided under this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5F7477DDB1B64110ABC01A319E9B584B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Administrative costs
                     Of the amounts made available under this section, the Secretary shall reserve not more than 5 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section.
                  
               
            
            
               4
               DOE loan and grant programs
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H62A0924CE63D4CBDBF3B6273154EA857"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50141.
                  FUNDING FOR DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY LOAN PROGRAMS OFFICE
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HBFAFC069571C4E0992E668FE4ADD332C"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Commitment authority
                     In addition to commitment authority otherwise available and previously provided, the Secretary may make commitments to guarantee loans for eligible projects under section 1703 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16513), up to a total principal amount of $40,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HD19B80DE262E42F9BB063A46B2B8B7C3"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available and previously provided, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,600,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, for the costs of guarantees made under section 1703 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16513), using the loan guarantee authority provided under subsection (a) of this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H03A1A6FA60BD4732958573CB72F897D5"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Administrative expenses
                     Of the amount made available under subsection (b), the Secretary shall reserve not more than 3 percent for administrative expenses to carry out title XVII of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 and for carrying out section 1702(h)(3) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 16512(h)(3)).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H7E016061C1D5492B974B5C3698F8E235"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Limitations
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H51DA29E3C9B64D49880B5977AF1DE4A9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Certification
                        None of the amounts made available under this section for loan guarantees shall be available for any project unless the President has certified in advance in writing that the loan guarantee and the project comply with the provisions under this section. 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4D160FFCC5314DF98FBA654C17F5A674"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Denial of double benefit
                        Except as provided in paragraph (3), none of the amounts made available under this section for loan guarantees shall be available for commitments to guarantee loans for any projects under which funds, personnel, or property (tangible or intangible) of any Federal agency, instrumentality, personnel, or affiliated entity are expected to be used (directly or indirectly) through acquisitions, contracts, demonstrations, exchanges, grants, incentives, leases, procurements, sales, other transaction authority, or other arrangements to support the project or to obtain goods or services from the project.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEFCAEE86F7C74D039C0599646CF2ABDA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Exception
                        Paragraph (2) shall not preclude the use of the loan guarantee authority provided under this section for commitments to guarantee loans for—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3AAA450D7CDF4E21A1306CFC564522C3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           projects benefitting from otherwise allowable Federal tax benefits;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0B7CF25861F14F5B801A0184A910D509"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           projects benefitting from being located on Federal land pursuant to a lease or right-of-way agreement for which all consideration for all uses is—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H01BAFBB0E5764729AAB31E8AC5E95980"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              paid exclusively in cash;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H26E8AC05DC034B728C4A3FB4F2C6BE38"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              deposited in the Treasury as offsetting receipts; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2900328D139549F6B955792BCED2EB08"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              equal to the fair market value;
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBE5B3908E6F642F7B43C0999307D44FC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           projects benefitting from the Federal insurance program under section 170 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2210); or
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H10CC6FBB7D8C4320A73426DB1B3A23A6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           electric generation projects using transmission facilities owned or operated by a Federal Power Marketing Administration or the Tennessee Valley Authority that have been authorized, approved, and financed independent of the project receiving the guarantee. 
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF207D94E4F5F4230801AF77EDF001DD4"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Guarantee
                     Section 1701(4)(A) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16511(4)(A)) is amended by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">, except that a loan guarantee may guarantee any debt obligation of a non-Federal borrower to any Eligible Lender (as defined in section 609.2 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations) before the period at the end.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H21167052862941ACBB253164187645AB"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (f)
                     Source of payments
                     Section 1702(b) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16512(b)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H144BE188E3C64917A805D8CF25152A2B"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA31F7B0CFEB477C81C2813838E0C010"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Source of payments
                           The source of a payment received from a borrower under subparagraph (A) or (B) of paragraph (2) may not be a loan or other debt obligation that is made or guaranteed by the Federal Government.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2711CFAB04544301BEA82E66F4DF7C54"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50142.
                  ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY VEHICLE MANUFACTURING
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB7047717492A482BA3153D0D1D81DB51"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2028, for the costs of providing direct loans under section 136(d) of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17013(d)): Provided, That funds appropriated by this section may be used for the costs of providing direct loans for reequipping, expanding, or establishing a manufacturing facility in the United States to produce, or for engineering integration performed in the United States of, advanced technology vehicles described in subparagraph (C), (D), (E), or (F) of section 136(a)(1) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 17013(a)(1)) only if such advanced technology vehicles emit, under any possible operational mode or condition, low or zero exhaust emissions of greenhouse gases.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H90C022C84C9046D09681D3B70742D4CA"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Administrative costs
                     The Secretary shall reserve not more than $25,000,000 of amounts made available under subsection (a) for administrative costs of providing loans as described in subsection (a).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H8862FB8CAF9C40C6AC7C134A547A5C3B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Elimination of loan program cap
                     Section 136(d)(1) of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17013(d)(1)) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">a total of not more than $25,000,000,000 in.
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H433FFC8DBC48477998C5DBBDBCB31EC6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50143.
                  DOMESTIC MANUFACTURING CONVERSION GRANTS
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H56B1704A9D2847E9BD0C2E977DAFC7CD"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to provide grants for domestic production of efficient hybrid, plug-in electric hybrid, plug-in electric drive, and hydrogen fuel cell electric vehicles, in accordance with section 712 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16062).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HA7CC67D8E3A444C787494D8584E608C1"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Cost share
                     The Secretary shall require a recipient of a grant provided under subsection (a) to provide not less than 50 percent of the cost of the project carried out using the grant.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H7909B0A4B4E8429C966F519A50A120DE"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Administrative costs
                     The Secretary shall reserve not more than 3 percent of amounts made available under subsection (a) for administrative costs of making grants described in such subsection (a) pursuant to section 712 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16062).
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1E21187B4DEE4973AB2F75759FD53C85"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50144.
                  ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE REINVESTMENT FINANCING
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H320E899319414DCA9DF0650A08722C3B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, to carry out activities under section 1706 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H3B6BBF300A2F4F23B68C420E6B3D6563"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Commitment authority
                     The Secretary may make, through September 30, 2026, commitments to guarantee loans for projects under section 1706 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 the total principal amount of which is not greater than $250,000,000,000, subject to the limitations that apply to loan guarantees under section 50141(d).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H3CD0EB7DC1964477A7137E4BC9FAAF9D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Energy infrastructure reinvestment financing
                     Title XVII of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended by inserting after section 1705 (42 U.S.C. 16516) the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HF9B618E734F942A68E775DCACC6F43D9"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3C92EB54AA5D46F4AE484FC87597B9E6"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes"
                                  section-type="subsequent-section">
                           1706.
                           ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE REINVESTMENT FINANCING
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HA8CE38AABC544AD2ACA94CD693E65EED"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (a)
                              In general
                              Notwithstanding section 1703, the Secretary may make guarantees, including refinancing, under this section only for projects that—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H87EA6DD0152A463FA297DF0217048138"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 retool, repower, repurpose, or replace energy infrastructure that has ceased operations; or
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD4C34EB774334307B4DB26745ABB4C45"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 enable operating energy infrastructure to avoid, reduce, utilize, or sequester air pollutants or anthropogenic emissions of greenhouse gases.
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H67F79F1C54874BB4A5C37928B76086C2"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (b)
                              Inclusion
                              A project under subsection (a) may include the remediation of environmental damage associated with energy infrastructure.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H23422E7509C74B169B5B4C3515D0FB08"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (c)
                              Requirement
                              A project under subsection (a)(1) that involves electricity generation through the use of fossil fuels shall be required to have controls or technologies to avoid, reduce, utilize, or sequester air pollutants and anthropogenic emissions of greenhouse gases.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H6CE6974963C84CC6977E09E166EC1976"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (d)
                              Application
                              To apply for a guarantee under this section, an applicant shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require, including—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9D1F54D3E76F4BC1849004B4D12D8C5F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 a detailed plan describing the proposed project;
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4416F4DF87EC4BC0A5CEC819C193DF98"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 an analysis of how the proposed project will engage with and affect associated communities; and
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAD7ACA1C028445519D1B8FB029E74F3F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (3)
                                 in the case of an applicant that is an electric utility, an assurance that the electric utility shall pass on any financial benefit from the guarantee made under this section to the customers of, or associated communities served by, the electric utility.
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HCC06566EFF8747E2B5019F633D3F2676"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (e)
                              Term
                              Notwithstanding section 1702(f), the term of an obligation shall require full repayment over a period not to exceed 30 years.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H0C3E1F17BB8743C9A0008BCB9A5C4374"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (f)
                              Definition of energy infrastructure
                              In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">energy infrastructure means a facility, and associated equipment, used for—
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0E612C259EC949D2801ED6FBF21CEE7B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 the generation or transmission of electric energy; or
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H626C800947D346078B16B8E6404082EF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 the production, processing, and delivery of fossil fuels, fuels derived from petroleum, or petrochemical feedstocks.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H1CE976E3E094482B82DE7B94E2517591"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Conforming amendment
                     Section 1702(o)(3) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16512(o)(3)) is amended by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and projects described in section 1706(a) before the period at the end.
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE7F05C784D984CF59C9846CE34416B96"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50145.
                  TRIBAL ENERGY LOAN GUARANTEE PROGRAM
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6BC01BAC083D46D19F7C91A4A1082588"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">

                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $75,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2028, to carry out section 2602(c) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 (25 U.S.C. 3502(c)), subject to the limitations that apply to loan guarantees under section 50141(d). 
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H308D501743E04AA4B34B95F0FB797DBC"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Department of Energy Tribal energy loan guarantee program
                     Section 2602(c) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 (25 U.S.C. 3502(c)) is amended—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCEB3EE56DB0F413E83E4BAC91CB433D1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        in paragraph (1), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">) for an amount equal to not more than 90 percent of and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">, except that a loan guarantee may guarantee any debt obligation of a non-Federal borrower to any Eligible Lender (as defined in section 609.2 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations)) for; and
