               5
               Electric transmission
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA7F3088B371F44DFB97FCC6144490F6A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50151.
                  TRANSMISSION FACILITY FINANCING
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEA2413C57ED4465981CFD4C31BC802CF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2030, to carry out this section: Provided, That the Secretary shall not enter into any loan agreement pursuant to this section that could result in disbursements after September 30, 2031.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEEA7A9E349984FD0AB92ABAE801C241E"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Use of funds
                     The Secretary shall use the amounts made available by subsection (a) to carry out a program to pay the costs of direct loans to non-Federal borrowers, subject to the limitations that apply to loan guarantees under section 50141(d) and under such terms and conditions as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, for the construction or modification of electric transmission facilities designated by the Secretary to be necessary in the national interest under section 216(a) of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 824p(a)).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4F2AE374A18E4D93B6DB0A2BA99E64F1"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Loans
                     A direct loan provided under this section—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB1CFA42C705E4B528E4C705937F30F21"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        shall have a term that does not exceed the lesser of—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6CD3D7580A894E34B600D74998B3C69D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           90 percent of the projected useful life, in years, of the eligible transmission facility; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF78FAFE1FAC040C4BA68782BA9CAB965"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           30 years;
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6B20704F970F48EFA83D66B44BD420FE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        shall not exceed 80 percent of the project costs; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2F2213E5F3346EBA02C07440C819FD7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        shall, on first issuance, be subject to the condition that the direct loan is not subordinate to other financing.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HE94D1E6227F84BDAB638FDC487DE4FFE"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Interest rates
                     A direct loan provided under this section shall bear interest at a rate determined by the Secretary, taking into consideration market yields on outstanding marketable obligations of the United States of comparable maturities as of the date on which the direct loan is made.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF9F6F3FB21FF4E8399E006E458400B69"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Definition of direct loan
                     In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">direct loan has the meaning given the term in section 502 of the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990 (2 U.S.C. 661a). 
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB0632089EBCE43569B4D6635FE057525"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50152.
                  GRANTS TO FACILITATE THE SITING OF INTERSTATE ELECTRICITY TRANSMISSION LINES
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB81D536068C8440D806DB4C0A89A23FF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $760,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2029, for making grants in accordance with this section and for administrative expenses associated with carrying out this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HD71488B4EF5342439061F0C24F89D93D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Use of funds
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H29A89DC435BA44D9AE25DE3164ED0DA8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        The Secretary may make a grant under this section to a siting authority for, with respect to a covered transmission project, any of the following activities:
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4EA53B81F5A242B8B5C234B88AFD1B86"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           Studies and analyses of the impacts of the covered transmission project.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H345B2E4D441C4577A344C3C56C56D169"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Examination of up to 3 alternate siting corridors within which the covered transmission project feasibly could be sited.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9FD8826838F64396956B8ED61ADE2962"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Participation by the siting authority in regulatory proceedings or negotiations in another jurisdiction, or under the auspices of a Transmission Organization (as defined in section 3 of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 796)) that is also considering the siting or permitting of the covered transmission project.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H389662A82320499DA254C067B82AEED7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Participation by the siting authority in regulatory proceedings at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or a State regulatory commission for determining applicable rates and cost allocation for the covered transmission project.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE30809320BFF4D33B6840EE01ACFD087"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           Other measures and actions that may improve the chances of, and shorten the time required for, approval by the siting authority of the application relating to the siting or permitting of the covered transmission project, as the Secretary determines appropriate.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB062DAAC0943412AADF45687C3083EE0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Economic development
                        The Secretary may make a grant under this section to a siting authority, or other State, local, or Tribal governmental entity, for economic development activities for communities that may be affected by the construction and operation of a covered transmission project, provided that the Secretary shall not enter into any grant agreement pursuant to this section that could result in any outlays after September 30, 2031.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H19ABDCA179B94483899A22B586E3D78D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Conditions
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0E239B7D56994E7D82E60E9A25269648"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Final decision on application
                        In order to receive a grant for an activity described in subsection (b)(1), the Secretary shall require a siting authority to agree, in writing, to reach a final decision on the application relating to the siting or permitting of the applicable covered transmission project not later than 2 years after the date on which such grant is provided, unless the Secretary authorizes an extension for good cause.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H10C87695356242ECA7BA88011A422510"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Federal share
                        The Federal share of the cost of an activity described in subparagraph (C) or (D) of subsection (b)(1) shall not exceed 50 percent.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3E0D23C2A92D408780AF57C3E88721EF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Economic development
                        The Secretary may only disburse grant funds for economic development activities under subsection (b)(2)—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD6A5030B220742A7B46CA3A7EA57A1B0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           to a siting authority upon approval by the siting authority of the applicable covered transmission project; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H83F6E8A47C4841D1956487F57119B3FD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           to any other State, local, or Tribal governmental entity upon commencement of construction of the applicable covered transmission project in the area under the jurisdiction of the entity.
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6A02BF3CB43449BBA3256ED2DA557C38"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Returning funds
                     If a siting authority that receives a grant for an activity described in subsection (b)(1) fails to use all grant funds within 2 years of receipt, the siting authority shall return to the Secretary any such unused funds.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HD3655C659EA74361B66F90BB3FB1012B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7A2DF622FB1B4D80A9825D932A1CC289"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Covered transmission project
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">covered transmission project means a high-voltage interstate or offshore electricity transmission line—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H32CCDB6881F344159C4A0F9FD82FA4DC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           that is proposed to be constructed and to operate—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H78AE96123CA94F0DA654378511ED3587"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              at a minimum of 275 kilovolts of either alternating-current or direct-current electric energy by an entity; or
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDFE4ABAC212D40E797CCFA22FBC8C1DF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              offshore and at a minimum of 200 kilovolts of either alternating-current or direct-current electric energy by an entity; and
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE8E4BB7FC4204925861AE4B2722A1BD7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           for which such entity has applied, or informed a siting authority of such entity’s intent to apply, for regulatory approval.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0236CCCA2EA741B08BD1E0D5A7580956"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Siting authority
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">siting authority means a State, local, or Tribal governmental entity with authority to make a final determination regarding the siting, permitting, or regulatory status of a covered transmission project that is proposed to be located in an area under the jurisdiction of the entity.
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H86D4D8115A85490484E2D46D81723618"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50153.
                  INTERREGIONAL AND OFFSHORE WIND ELECTRICITY TRANSMISSION PLANNING, MODELING, AND ANALYSIS
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9029EFB2F1EA4A469038C35E4540B648"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to carry out this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H7A4EE58788F44903B169E2F8D2E04EEF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Use of funds
                     The Secretary shall use amounts made available under subsection (a)—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H49580653E12D4D509C5CD4CAA0D7B4F6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to pay expenses associated with convening relevant stakeholders to address the development of interregional electricity transmission and transmission of electricity that is generated by offshore wind; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H55812B9275A94191AA682C7AD42D8AE1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to conduct planning, modeling, and analysis regarding interregional electricity transmission and transmission of electricity that is generated by offshore wind, taking into account the local, regional, and national economic, reliability, resilience, security, public policy, and environmental benefits of interregional electricity transmission and transmission of electricity that is generated by offshore wind, including planning, modeling, and analysis, as the Secretary determines appropriate, pertaining to—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H135D931B8C14427DB50A45AEFA75C04A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           clean energy integration into the electric grid, including the identification of renewable energy zones;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H98C5FDFF03C9433999754D123482C4FA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           the effects of changes in weather due to climate change on the reliability and resilience of the electric grid;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF4AD632136A54AAEBD0A855E89B2FEA6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           cost allocation methodologies that facilitate the expansion of the bulk power system;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H388A205E0493469BAEA62C2EC8BE81B3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           the benefits of coordination between generator interconnection processes and transmission planning processes;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H242051382BB347E18354A0D07E40A31C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           the effect of increased electrification on the electric grid;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF49908D04BF04319943ED5F540C57C6B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (F)
                           power flow modeling;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD6FE3D3778E84E4D8771B16F35BE86D8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (G)
                           the benefits of increased interconnections or interties between or among the Western Interconnection, the Eastern Interconnection, the Electric Reliability Council of Texas, and other interconnections, as applicable;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H485BFDD5FF644CBEB0249DC6B5E9B57E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (H)
                           the cooptimization of transmission and generation, including variable energy resources, energy storage, and demand-side management;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD5928FFEB4594C7DBDA0725C39AD71E4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (I)
                           the opportunities for use of nontransmission alternatives, energy storage, and grid-enhancing technologies;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3D928DC263F4434AB55DC3CEF7E3D60A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (J)
                           economic development opportunities for communities arising from development of interregional electricity transmission and transmission of electricity that is generated by offshore wind;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCCCFF92656F84924A2FB6F75AF841DAF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (K)
                           evaluation of existing rights-of-way and the need for additional transmission corridors; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4AAA11198CD64A8881C35CB150E02508"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (L)
                           a planned national transmission grid, which would include a networked transmission system to optimize the existing grid for interconnection of offshore wind farms.
                        
                     
                  
               
            
            
               6
               Industrial
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0FD29F5CECD449E5BDDF7BA10B48E485"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50161.
                  ADVANCED INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HE30D113960F14FFDBEC376E70B424309"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Office of clean energy demonstrations
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Office of Clean Energy Demonstrations, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,812,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, to carry out this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4A6490F253474F76AF8D3789CF8CAC0D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Financial assistance
                     The Secretary shall use funds appropriated by subsection (a) to provide financial assistance, on a competitive basis, to eligible entities to carry out projects for—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H896048778A594A5799DF4A6497DCD17A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        the purchase and installation, or implementation, of advanced industrial technology at an eligible facility;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2794F6CE9BE045618FD14057349935DA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        retrofits, upgrades to, or operational improvements at an eligible facility to install or implement advanced industrial technology; or
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD95330938D3449359569BD3953AFC37C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        engineering studies and other work needed to prepare an eligible facility for activities described in paragraph (1) or (2).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HE6B533354A5B4AA6AB5E262D9CA580B2"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Application
                     To be eligible to receive financial assistance under subsection (b), an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require, including the expected greenhouse gas emissions reductions to be achieved by carrying out the project.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H1E0292C89008479D84D9569002DF0F73"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Priority
                     In providing financial assistance under subsection (b), the Secretary shall give priority consideration to projects on the basis of, as determined by the Secretary—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAE3DE86F96324444B936E813342E79BF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        the expected greenhouse gas emissions reductions to be achieved by carrying out the project;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9B97BA7920674B208E43EC31691B0506"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        the extent to which the project would provide the greatest benefit for the greatest number of people within the area in which the eligible facility is located; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE41969F6873244DA9D8530466A144488"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        whether the eligible entity participates or would participate in a partnership with purchasers of the output of the eligible facility.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H95072C042A674A6CB0D20892B29F2B74"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Cost share
                     The Secretary shall require an eligible entity to provide not less than 50 percent of the cost of a project carried out pursuant to this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB77CD2DA153E441C91A55A293ADC613D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (f)
                     Administrative costs
                     The Secretary shall reserve not more than $300,000,000 of amounts made available under subsection (a) for administrative costs of carrying out this section.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HDB3823E17472445686D9749C2341E9AF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (g)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFAD0FE18499748959662728A1D08C53E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Advanced industrial technology
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">advanced industrial technology means a technology directly involved in an industrial process, as described in any of paragraphs (1) through (6) of section 454(c) of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17113(c)), and designed to accelerate greenhouse gas emissions reduction progress to net-zero at an eligible facility, as determined by the Secretary.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3D3A4C49E81649EA83F6B8CA24B853B9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Eligible entity
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">eligible entity means the owner or operator of an eligible facility.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0235188EC0B040299EDF7C444F0D55D4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Eligible facility
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">eligible facility means a domestic, non-Federal, nonpower industrial or manufacturing facility engaged in energy-intensive industrial processes, including production processes for iron, steel, steel mill products, aluminum, cement, concrete, glass, pulp, paper, industrial ceramics, chemicals, and other energy intensive industrial processes, as determined by the Secretary.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB1DD4A53A1E445A5859167006513C7F9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Financial assistance
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">financial assistance means a grant, rebate, direct loan, or cooperative agreement.
                     
                  
               
            
            
               7
               Other energy matters
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H48FB4E94A5084EF1BEB16946A81E7065"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50171.
                  DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY OVERSIGHT
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $20,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for oversight by the Department of Energy Office of Inspector General of the Department of Energy activities for which funding is appropriated in this subtitle.
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H8081814D16E24DB19150DECF45E49470"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50172.
                  NATIONAL LABORATORY INFRASTRUCTURE
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC91BAE7D9B874AFC9D7948D4142C1617"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Office of science
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Director of the Office of Science, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available through September 30, 2027—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD95C88237BE84A2E9E91576FA5791FDB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        $133,240,000 to carry out activities for science laboratory infrastructure projects;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H946FD2B282EC4D36B4E0A6D8D24FB959"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        $303,656,000 to carry out activities for high energy physics construction and major items of equipment projects;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H148273F2E71842689200EAFC8C1C9CA3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        $280,000,000 to carry out activities for fusion energy science construction and major items of equipment projects;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H417D3D0D31224036B3958DED062635DB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        $217,000,000 to carry out activities for nuclear physics construction and major items of equipment projects;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCBFDD32053C9416A92F01D7A11008143"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        $163,791,000 to carry out activities for advanced scientific computing research facilities;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA9A1E68F48B247D291F5C1BAB7CD9511"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        $294,500,000 to carry out activities for basic energy sciences projects; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H40DFD949A3614FD18D1E1618EF073EBB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (7)
                        $157,813,000 to carry out activities for isotope research and development facilities.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H7ABF6A3EEDC5403C9AB688EF808DE979"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Office of fossil energy and carbon management
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2027, to carry out activities for infrastructure and general plant projects carried out by the Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H2D52DCB42F7F42D0A224E0E5B9DD4C69"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Office of nuclear energy
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2027, to carry out activities for infrastructure and general plant projects carried out by the Office of Nuclear Energy.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB571A32B81E24EC4A74785D239EE99FA"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Office of energy efficiency and renewable energy
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2027, to carry out activities for infrastructure and general plant projects carried out by the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy.
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFB2EE56E1D5648F282032E197A08EAA9"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50173.
                  AVAILABILITY OF HIGH-ASSAY LOW-ENRICHED URANIUM
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4E59B064C75F4B5C825F495A4D1FC3B7"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Appropriations
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available through September 30, 2026—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H341626C5E2214074BA2B68EA0E715FCA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        $100,000,000 to carry out the program elements described in subparagraphs (A) through (C) of section 2001(a)(2) of the Energy Act of 2020 (42 U.S.C. 16281(a)(2));
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1D6DD007269F49B4858277BF0EA65531"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        $500,000,000 to carry out the program elements described in subparagraphs (D) through (H) of that section; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF85BC122E0D04559991DEF45D488CCB0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        $100,000,000 to carry out activities to support the availability of high-assay low-enriched uranium for civilian domestic research, development, demonstration, and commercial use under section 2001 of the Energy Act of 2020 (42 U.S.C. 16281).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H7B121811BDAB4CDC9BEF8962C55291C1"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Competitive procedures
                     To the maximum extent practicable, the Department of Energy shall, in a manner consistent with section 989 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16353), use a competitive, merit-based review process in carrying out research, development, demonstration, and deployment activities under section 2001 of the Energy Act of 2020 (42 U.S.C. 16281).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC7CEBBA3A1074A3E9D30B99A56E116C8"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Administrative expenses
                     The Secretary may use not more than 3 percent of the amounts appropriated by subsection (a) for administrative purposes.
                  
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H70FB751262E644C7BB2C7E296E1FB3CB"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            B
            Natural resources
            
               1
               General provisions
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2D50F6C1BE0E40C3920517149ED96F5C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50211.
                  DEFINITIONS
                  In this subtitle:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCF215576DA8A4690B7FF9E946E529C05"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Secretary
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFFA8763035D2405894A0627582D0AB9E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     United states insular areas
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">United States Insular Areas means American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the United States Virgin Islands.
                  
               
            
            
               2
               Public lands
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC0766F7EF42A44B8835B0AB76B79AF16"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50221.
                  NATIONAL PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS CONSERVATION AND RESILIENCE
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to carry out projects for the conservation, protection, and resiliency of lands and resources administered by the National Park Service and Bureau of Land Management. None of the funds provided under this section shall be subject to cost-share or matching requirements.
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H53BA8ADD203F45FC807988CBA3F91201"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50222.
                  NATIONAL PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS CONSERVATION AND ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to carry out conservation, ecosystem and habitat restoration projects on lands administered by the National Park Service and Bureau of Land Management. None of the funds provided under this section shall be subject to cost-share or matching requirements.
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD45180ED103F4B6A874304FE27321054"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50223.
                  NATIONAL PARK SERVICE EMPLOYEES
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $500,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2030, to hire employees to serve in units of the National Park System or national historic or national scenic trails administered by the National Park Service.
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA32EDA1274444BD395F6DDDAE7820CB0"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50224.
                  NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM DEFERRED MAINTENANCE
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $200,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, to carry out priority deferred maintenance projects, through direct expenditures or transfers, within the boundaries of the National Park System.
               
            
            
               3
               Drought response and preparedness
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H45A665A6CCF942FA9FD6D8BACA514F98"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50231.
                  BUREAU OF RECLAMATION DOMESTIC WATER SUPPLY PROJECTS
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Commissioner of Reclamation, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $550,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for grants, contracts, or financial assistance agreements for disadvantaged communities (identified according to criteria adopted by the Commissioner of Reclamation) in a manner as determined by the Commissioner of Reclamation for up to 100 percent of the cost of the planning, design, or construction of water projects the primary purpose of which is to provide domestic water supplies to communities or households that do not have reliable access to domestic water supplies in a State or territory described in the first section of the Act of June 17, 1902 (43 U.S.C. 391; 32 Stat. 388, chapter 1093).
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFFCC0E516ADF45CEB1E46C5701A36607"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50232.
                  CANAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Commissioner of Reclamation, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $25,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for the design, study, and implementation of projects (including pilot and demonstration projects) to cover water conveyance facilities with solar panels to generate renewable energy in a manner as determined by the Secretary or for other solar projects associated with Bureau of Reclamation projects that increase water efficiency and assist in implementation of clean energy goals. 
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HF8D6391444F9429E849B7D9C619AD142"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50233.
                  DROUGHT MITIGATION IN THE RECLAMATION STATES
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HDEAA3D6004034B81AC104EE108554AAA"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Definition of reclamation state
                     In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Reclamation State means a State or territory described in the first section of the Act of June 17, 1902 (32 Stat. 388, chapter 1093; 43 U.S.C. 391).
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H8A4ED3E18C2D425597C563467A3C7703"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Appropriation
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary (acting through the Commissioner of Reclamation), for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $4,000,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, for grants, contracts, or financial assistance agreements, in accordance with the reclamation laws, to or with public entities and Indian Tribes, that provide for the conduct of the following activities to mitigate the impacts of drought in the Reclamation States, with priority given to the Colorado River Basin and other basins experiencing comparable levels of long-term drought, to be implemented in compliance with applicable environmental law:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2376CA3B6C4444BDA0DE93D49CEB4272"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Compensation for a temporary or multiyear voluntary reduction in diversion of water or consumptive water use.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H87AB5264741949B8909BB741ADDE6736"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Voluntary system conservation projects that achieve verifiable reductions in use of or demand for water supplies or provide environmental benefits in the Lower Basin or Upper Basin of the Colorado River.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE30DDFBA0D6446F79049EC043E585CAD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Ecosystem and habitat restoration projects to address issues directly caused by drought in a river basin or inland water body.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H0FBEA1449E964AE1A627033DE6907079"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Report
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and each year thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report that describes any expenditures under this section. 
                  
               
            
            
               4
               Insular affairs
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H5B9E12F51ACC4C9FB399895B56F5E8A4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50241.
                  OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS CLIMATE CHANGE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H339DC112257948BD80AE3B04729436ED"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     In general
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Office of Insular Affairs, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $15,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, to provide technical assistance for climate change planning, mitigation, adaptation, and resilience to United States Insular Areas.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB168D980CEC046A8B6ED8E86AFEA001E"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Administrative expenses
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Office of Insular Affairs, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $900,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, for necessary administrative expenses associated with carrying out this section.

               Offshore wind

                               qb-display-quote="yes">

                     The Secretary may grant leases, easements, and rights-of-way pursuant to section 8(p)(1)(C) of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1337(p)(1)(C)) in an area withdrawn by—

                                 qb-display-quote="yes">

                        the Presidential memorandum entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Memorandum on the Withdrawal of Certain Areas of the United States Outer Continental Shelf from Leasing Disposition and dated September 8, 2020; or

                                 id="H42A9C0B20F1048669859C2777100B942"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">

                                 Application

                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Wind lease sales for areas of the outer continental shelf
                        The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1331 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="HBF8F520983B44ACD8D719DA390530E68"

                                     id="H8B8429AF11D0487BADD0BEB61E4EB3C3"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes"
                                     section-type="subsequent-section">
                              33.
                              WIND LEASE SALES FOR AREAS OF THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF OFFSHORE OF TERRITORIES OF THE UNITED STATES
                              <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H4172718A13E94657A2F2B0D03D08A7DD"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (a)
                                 Wind lease sales off coasts of territories of the united states
                                 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD80CA6E929ED466AB6532E15C5A9F2A3"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (1)
                                    Call for information and nominations
                                    <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="H6F3896482B6142BDAF75EA5E7F4D1676"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (A)
                                       In general
                                       The Secretary shall issue calls for information and nominations for proposed wind lease sales for areas of the outer Continental Shelf described in paragraph (2) that are determined to be feasible.
                                    
                                    <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="HB00DAE2DF67044EDA8BB33D4510EFE3C"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (B)
                                       Initial call
                                       Not later than September 30, 2025, the Secretary shall issue an initial call for information and nominations under this paragraph.
                                    
                                 
                                 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7ABAD2D5199E4C1BACCDBB2CE5964DA0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (2)
                                    Conditional wind lease sales
                                    The Secretary may conduct wind lease sales in each area within the exclusive economic zone of the United States adjacent to the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, or the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands that meets each of the following criteria:
                                    <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="H2C2BC15E4A7D464B81AEB88B4BEA41FA"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (A)
                                       The Secretary has concluded that a wind lease sale in the area is feasible.
                                    
                                    <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="HE23CDF77B0B04EFE9DE9A7DC9510D8FD"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (B)
                                       The Secretary has determined that there is sufficient interest in leasing the area.
                                    
                                    <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                   id="H20C0F33C0F3B427AB3B88BFCE1BE997E"
                                                   qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (C)
                                       The Secretary has consulted with the Governor of the territory regarding the suitability of the area for wind energy development.

               6
               Fossil fuel resources
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H30C87EE0092A482AADCBC40DE6924D7A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50261.
                  OFFSHORE OIL AND GAS ROYALTY RATE
                  Section 8(a)(1) of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1337(a)(1)) is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HECCD6925F0704F33ABC12187F36F6B8F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                      in each of subparagraphs (A) and (C), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">not less than 121/2 per centum each place it appears and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">not less than 162/3 percent, but not more than 183/4 percent, during the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of the Act titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of S. Con. Res. 14, and not less than 162/3 percent thereafter,;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFD3AB4E802F64F28BFAA723AF107EE46"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subparagraph (F), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">no less than 121/2 per centum and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">not less than 162/3 percent, but not more than 183/4 percent, during the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of the Act titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of S. Con. Res. 14, and not less than 162/3 percent thereafter,; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAC74B007D1434EFE92E20CDE78624DFA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     in subparagraph (H), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">no less than 12 and 1/2 per centum and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">not less than 162/3 percent, but not more than 183/4 percent, during the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of the Act titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of S. Con. Res. 14, and not less than 162/3 percent thereafter,.
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H102058424F5240ACAEB20DC9D702FE81"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50262.
                  MINERAL LEASING ACT MODERNIZATION
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HFDB15524EF8A4567A1F89F34305705C3"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Onshore oil and gas royalty rates
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2146A804EC73487091973BD1A5E46531"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Lease of oil and gas land
                        Section 17 of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226) is amended—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4284DEFED6D84286B87E16549304E2C9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           in subsection (b)(1)(A), in the fifth sentence—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H86E450441D3440549050601983D7EF5C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">12.5 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">162/3
                                 ; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3B007A16163246CAA0B17CD21F5B132D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">or, in the case of a lease issued during the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of the Act titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of S. Con. Res. 14, 162/3 percent in amount or value of the production removed or sold from the lease before the period at the end; and
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H01F6C4B57E844045A1E95575CCD9A50A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">12½ per centum each place it appears and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">162/3 percent.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9E82301D399D4FE9BAB894E0C6A79FFC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Conditions for reinstatement
                        Section 31(e)(3) of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 188(e)(3)) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"

                     (d)
                     Expression of interest fee
                     Section 17 of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226) is amended by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HCF1470D0D6A7423F88DD23ED286CA408"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H80D3E4AAB4264224AC19353531879998"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (q)
                           Fee for expression of interest
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H78878B573C984EB3B2807141C47DE5C4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Secretary shall assess a nonrefundable fee against any person that, in accordance with procedures established by the Secretary to carry out this subsection, submits an expression of interest in leasing land available for disposition under this section for exploration for, and development of, oil or gas.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDBFBE8D05E574BB3AB7ADF42DF12540C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Amount of fee
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H18EE7DC81BDC40AFA864ED38F398A14A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 Subject to subparagraph (B), the fee assessed under paragraph (1) shall be $5 per acre of the area covered by the applicable expression of interest.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB5D5DE0624F049D291B0B804CCBD151A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Adjustment of fee
                                 The Secretary shall, by regulation, not less frequently than every 4 years, adjust the amount of the fee under subparagraph (A) to reflect the change in inflation.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"

                              <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="HB7D2BC6A75904BE59809DD7F40E7F259"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (c)
                                 Additional rounds of competitive bidding
                                 Land made available for leasing under subsection (b)(1) for which no bid is accepted or received, or the land for which a lease terminates, expires, is cancelled, or is relinquished, may be made available by the Secretary of the Interior for a new round of competitive bidding under that subsection.
                              
                              ; and

                                       id="H299C58C7C5DA4387BDB860E36004D572"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           by striking subsection (e) and inserting the following:
                           <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                          display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          display-quotes="yes"

                                          style="OLC">
                              <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="HA5E46A42D26046728709814FD062A2BC"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (e)
                                 Term of lease
                                 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB8BA5E1728AE41E3ABF49CB048E56280"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (1)
                                    In general
                                    Any lease issued under this section, including a lease for tar sand areas, shall be for a primary term of 10 years.
                                 
                                 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H42089368626E43DF87B51ED68236B21D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (2)
                                    Continuation of lease
                                    A lease described in paragraph (1) shall continue after the primary term of the lease for any period during which oil or gas is produced in paying quantities.
                                 
                                 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1565EAAC3BB34C809A52823D08EB7555"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (3)
                                    Additional extensions
                                    Any lease issued under this section for land on which, or for which under an approved cooperative or unit plan of development or operation, actual drilling operations were commenced and diligently prosecuted prior to the end of the primary term of the lease shall be extended for 2 years and for any period thereafter during which oil or gas is produced in paying quantities.
                                 
                              
                              .

               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H447D9A2DF57A4A44A1B755172ABA46A2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50263.
                  ROYALTIES ON ALL EXTRACTED METHANE
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9ABF6C8623494B52A014F9F2018553EB"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     In general
                     For all leases issued after the date of enactment of this Act, except as provided in subsection (b), royalties paid for gas produced from Federal land and on the outer Continental Shelf shall be assessed on all gas produced, including all gas that is consumed or lost by venting, flaring, or negligent releases through any equipment during upstream operations.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5DA756958E0D4906818F49C92415CE1C"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Exception
                     Subsection (a) shall not apply with respect to—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAD2B96AFD3284D4892858A083FD7AC27"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        gas vented or flared for not longer than 48 hours in an emergency situation that poses a danger to human health, safety, or the environment;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H298E9E985CA44E08AD8ECF923E811CDA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        gas used or consumed within the area of the lease, unit, or communitized area for the benefit of the lease, unit, or communitized area; or
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB1EE81CBB07448A2846A3F128587105F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        gas that is unavoidably lost.
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3C09C1D7816E468C922C24F0D121886F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50264.
                  LEASE SALES UNDER THE 2017–2022 OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF LEASING PROGRAM
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H3CFC76C6A24D42A2A0CE4645C7DFDD57"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H88406486120D46AB8A5BA9B19BB29BC3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Lease sale 257
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Lease Sale 257 means the lease sale numbered 257 that was approved in the Record of Decision described in the notice of availability of a record of decision issued on August 31, 2021, entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Gulf of Mexico, Outer Continental Shelf (OCS), Oil and Gas Lease Sale 257 (86 Fed. Reg. 50160 (September 7, 2021)), and is the subject of the final notice of sale entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Gulf of Mexico Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Lease Sale 257 (86 Fed. Reg. 54728 (October 4, 2021)).
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC6B517987C494A8F910AFB27719F57D3"
