                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Lease sale 258
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Lease Sale 258 means the lease sale numbered 258 described in the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program published on November 18, 2016, and approved by the Secretary in the Record of Decision issued on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)).
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H76042534F0F848929F55F8CDD7785249"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Lease sale 259
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Lease Sale 259 means the lease sale numbered 259 described in the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program published on November 18, 2016, and approved by the Secretary in the Record of Decision issued on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)). 
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7AA65BC191CD4FEE8EFBE8C7736EB1AC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Lease sale 261
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Lease Sale 261 means the lease sale numbered 261 described in the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program published on November 18, 2016, and approved by the Secretary in the Record of Decision issued on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9F4046D1908E48E084DC5AAF289EF527"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Lease sale 257 reinstatement
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE3A36688AFED4E94AEE9EACA3EE93966"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Acceptance of bids
                        Not later 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall, without modification or delay—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB311818B66BF4AD2B8495960D08C19B8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           accept the highest valid bid for each tract or bidding unit of Lease Sale 257 for which a valid bid was received on November 17, 2021; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE0FB50C346684CFF8CF9E8FC65077D0A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           provide the appropriate lease form to the winning bidder to execute and return.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAFCC533EAC424316B2A1E78C448EB99D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Lease issuance
                        On receipt of an executed lease form under paragraph (1)(B) and payment of the rental for the first year, the balance of the bonus bid (unless deferred), and any required bond or security from the high bidder, the Secretary shall promptly issue to the high bidder a fully executed lease, in accordance with—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H63137E94D1944B0295D5E2FCB079FE36"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           the regulations in effect on the date of Lease Sale 257; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6F1EEC5478934A938ABBC6130066AA4E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           the terms and conditions of the final notice of sale entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Gulf of Mexico Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Lease Sale 257 (86 Fed. Reg. 54728 (October 4, 2021)).
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5152E64AAE7A423E9427AF7254786360"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Requirement for Lease Sale 258
                     Notwithstanding the expiration of the 2017–2022 leasing program, not later than December 31, 2022, the Secretary shall conduct Lease Sale 258 in accordance with the Record of Decision approved by the Secretary on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 issued on January 17, 2017 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)). 
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H75800EE424DD4F04B13DCAD75599F0AB"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Requirement for lease sale 259
                     Notwithstanding the expiration of the 2017–2022 leasing program, not later than March 31, 2023, the Secretary shall conduct Lease Sale 259 in accordance with the Record of Decision approved by the Secretary on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 issued on January 17, 2017 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)). 
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6043A240B11949E887793258E3976982"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Requirement for lease sale 261
                     Notwithstanding the expiration of the 2017–2022 leasing program, not later than September 30, 2023, the Secretary shall conduct Lease Sale 261 in accordance with the Record of Decision approved by the Secretary on January 17, 2017, described in the notice of availability entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Record of Decision for the 2017–2022 Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program Final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement; MMAA104000 issued on January 17, 2017 (82 Fed. Reg. 6643 (January 19, 2017)).
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H31034C00A0E44FCFB791CA0B6A5EFB57"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50265.
                  ENSURING ENERGY SECURITY
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H8304EEA92BF74C26A87013040B4AE712"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     Definitions
                     In this section:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H30216736A8F54D1CAF953A98AFC3098A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Federal land
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Federal land means public lands (as defined in section 103 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1702)).
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDBF93BC5D56E4B02A79FA6576812F338"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Offshore lease sale
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">offshore lease sale means an oil and gas lease sale—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H120982AFE5DD4A63B718588F92A47F39"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           that is held by the Secretary in accordance with the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1331 et seq.); and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCA0F18D5820648F8A76F12D005CAEED2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           that, if any acceptable bids have been received for any tract offered in the lease sale, results in the issuance of a lease.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H56B86E2D0E6D466B8ACDCDB584FC6AFD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Onshore lease sale
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">onshore lease sale means a quarterly oil and gas lease sale—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC19B554FC2234599878EDDE99070F5B3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           that is held by the Secretary in accordance with section 17 of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226); and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFD438A0FCB8E432CAEDC5383BEBB1842"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           that, if any acceptable bids have been received for any parcel offered in the lease sale, results in the issuance of a lease.
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC105130BF2924096ADCFBF0A34CA1D87"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Limitation on issuance of certain leases or rights-of-way
                     During the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H606FBFB77B244827BB3D63B15ACAE915"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        the Secretary may not issue a right-of-way for wind or solar energy development on Federal land unless—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H854F5CBACC1848779EF1D0CAF544B3D7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           an onshore lease sale has been held during the 120-day period ending on the date of the issuance of the right-of-way for wind or solar energy development; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8CA87AEF2DFB4FCCA3413C9097A1C665"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           the sum total of acres offered for lease in onshore lease sales during the 1-year period ending on the date of the issuance of the right-of-way for wind or solar energy development is not less than the lesser of—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4DA9747A49564913B353BA6B98A8904E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              2,000,000 acres; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1B7C00C27ED5424093F6C18460870ED6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              50 percent of the acreage for which expressions of interest have been submitted for lease sales during that period; and
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB006654A0B314905AD3460CC9C1AF39E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        the Secretary may not issue a lease for offshore wind development under section 8(p)(1)(C) of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1337(p)(1)(C)) unless—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCD2B0ED844434CCDA8EF7A38026BD111"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           an offshore lease sale has been held during the 1-year period ending on the date of the issuance of the lease for offshore wind development; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3F1511F496634F979D8D8CF686C28B88"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           the sum total of acres offered for lease in offshore lease sales during the 1-year period ending on the date of the issuance of the lease for offshore wind development is not less than 60,000,000 acres.
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6F91479AD18E420ABD99F9BBB5397908"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Savings
                     Except as expressly provided in paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (b), nothing in this section supersedes, amends, or modifies existing law. 
                  
               
            
            
               7
               United States Geological Survey
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBB77E2AFD6304DEA81D66BA181A71177"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50271.
                  UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 3D ELEVATION PROGRAM
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary, acting through the Director of the United States Geological Survey, for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $23,500,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to produce, collect, disseminate, and use 3D elevation data. 
               
            
            
               8
               Other natural resources matters
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1BC23F9E637D4E31BDEDA854A1801F73"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  50281.
                  DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR OVERSIGHT
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $10,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for oversight by the Department of the Interior Office of Inspector General of the Department of the Interior activities for which funding is appropriated in this subtitle. 
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H1DBBC649A4E943DC8B972D8F13E5C0D2"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            C
            Environmental reviews
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H11CCFA6467D54CFCA42643617F3A183F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               50301.
               DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Energy for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $115,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to provide for the hiring and training of personnel, the development of programmatic environmental documents, the procurement of technical or scientific services for environmental reviews, the development of environmental data or information systems, stakeholder and community engagement, and the purchase of new equipment for environmental analysis to facilitate timely and efficient environmental reviews and authorizations.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4FC616E4244542AD94674B2F8DF202EE"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               50302.
               FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H70D83F53E7E645738FF718C71E6188CC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to provide for the hiring and training of personnel, the development of programmatic environmental documents, the procurement of technical or scientific services for environmental reviews, the development of environmental data or information systems, stakeholder and community engagement, and the purchase of new equipment for environmental analysis to facilitate timely and efficient environmental reviews and authorizations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1DEC9CEEB02C4CBDA592E82CF3F41F4C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Fees and charges
                  Section 3401(a) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1986 (42 U.S.C. 7178(a)) shall not apply to the costs incurred by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission in carrying out this section.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H476FB0EB7A8441BE88E0E892E79B05FA"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               50303.
               DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of the Interior for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $150,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2026, to provide for the hiring and training of personnel, the development of programmatic environmental documents, the procurement of technical or scientific services for environmental reviews, the development of environmental data or information systems, stakeholder and community engagement, and the purchase of new equipment for environmental analysis to facilitate timely and efficient environmental reviews and authorizations by the National Park Service, the Bureau of Land Management, the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, the Bureau of Reclamation, the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, and the Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement. 
            
         
      
      <title id="HC4ACBCE104AE4758BEE1E4BCAA311D7C"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         VI
         COMMITTEE ON ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC WORKS
         <subtitle id="HD2476D198D414511A35B7242DEA44FB9"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            A
            Air Pollution
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H1A50C7DA28414CF993FFE2C2ADBBF016"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60101.
               CLEAN HEAVY-DUTY VEHICLES
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 131 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 7431) the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HB07B4274EE854A69B6D495F4BDB0BBAE"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE6AFA805413B4EC99BD2490DF43F6506"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     132.
                     CLEAN HEAVY-DUTY VEHICLES
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H1037870D02EC42849F7F2C418B87B9AF"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriations
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC6BC87CFEF474772B77062E1EB3F47CC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $600,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to carry out this section.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57B3487317FA4634875827C090509C1B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Nonattainment areas
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $400,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to make awards under this section to eligible recipients and to eligible contractors that propose to replace eligible vehicles to serve 1 or more communities located in an air quality area designated pursuant to section 107 as nonattainment for any air pollutant. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8BBE64138700466DBA0252D5C60CE412"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Reservation
                           Of the funds appropriated by paragraph (1), the Administrator shall reserve 3 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3E8CE7FFF7AE48BD80AEAA15F788B87D"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Program
                        Beginning not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall implement a program to make awards of grants and rebates to eligible recipients, and to make awards of contracts to eligible contractors for providing rebates, for up to 100 percent of costs for—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2018B2B87AF049FB84CFCD64C99894F7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           the incremental costs of replacing an eligible vehicle that is not a zero-emission vehicle with a zero-emission vehicle, as determined by the Administrator based on the market value of the vehicles;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H652FA42A6B4D4CCAA55CD0C7CB0AD9B9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           purchasing, installing, operating, and maintaining infrastructure needed to charge, fuel, or maintain zero-emission vehicles;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7DE21DDE634943B69AA277E9518BDF1F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           workforce development and training to support the maintenance, charging, fueling, and operation of zero-emission vehicles; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9C02EC65199F4B468D42D72238FA30A5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           planning and technical activities to support the adoption and deployment of zero-emission vehicles.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H7AF9DA42B2A345209AD80D0A90A2D8F1"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Applications
                        To seek an award under this section, an eligible recipient or eligible contractor shall submit to the Administrator an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Administrator shall prescribe.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HAC2EBF693EA04D1C83DEA0F013063570"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Definitions
                        For purposes of this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H34663FD2EBAA4CC0A27E16F24BD8BB67"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Eligible contractor
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible contractor means a contractor that has the capacity—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1A1F566F0C3B42C0B5B594A2CF1FF4F9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to sell, lease, license, or contract for service zero-emission vehicles, or charging or other equipment needed to charge, fuel, or maintain zero-emission vehicles, to individuals or entities that own, lease, license, or contract for service an eligible vehicle; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3E1A234FCC234E7A8B1BF0BA79FBA64D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to arrange financing for such a sale, lease, license, or contract for service.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4924283459A3428BB0C37C729FD1E469"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Eligible recipient
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible recipient means—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H07D43E7B6DC9445D86C2C6ACEA33094A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a State;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0C1B493AFFF44904BD7B9BCE2151A33C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              a municipality;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA9F42D263CAA4F4B8E7FDA405AD7B880"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              an Indian tribe; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H13DDFBCBCC5641808B5FC410D8183142"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              a nonprofit school transportation association.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC4BF54D821A04B128AD0FEB7AE9D323D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Eligible vehicle
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible vehicle means a Class 6 or Class 7 heavy-duty vehicle as defined in section 1037.801 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this section).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA3878EEE540B48B19BAA31BB2F155D9A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Greenhouse gas
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3BCD7CCEC2C447A7996760133A14B31A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Zero-emission vehicle
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">zero-emission vehicle means a vehicle that has a drivetrain that produces, under any possible operational mode or condition, zero exhaust emissions of—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H49B4C788C5794A53A0B64685916131A6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              any air pollutant that is listed pursuant to section 108(a) (or any precursor to such an air pollutant); and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H39F83A11CB03495EB0E1239F4F94297A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              any greenhouse gas.
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4F0B0AE2699342E29C0780D15104417D"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60102.
               GRANTS TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION AT PORTS
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 132 of such Act, as added by section 60101 of this Act, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H4E0BFFD352E54B298A86494809BEA138"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2A9DE068C997486F9BEE396B6CCCA3E4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     133.
                     GRANTS TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION AT PORTS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H2D30E24F88BE49EC935FFE649F54384A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriations
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5A80C074D2684AEEA236F84F515C89B3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           General assistance
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,250,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2027, to award rebates and grants to eligible recipients on a competitive basis—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4C461EB4146B42A1AAF7785BE71C0161"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to purchase or install zero-emission port equipment or technology for use at, or to directly serve, one or more ports;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1B15B12A76584527AC95A3E08BCC482B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to conduct any relevant planning or permitting in connection with the purchase or installation of such zero-emission port equipment or technology; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8BF148FA0FA34348A52E89E8D0B78CE9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              to develop qualified climate action plans.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HED14A3F6D2A94CD9856E86B684E174FC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Nonattainment areas
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $750,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2027, to award rebates and grants to eligible recipients to carry out activities described in paragraph (1) with respect to ports located in air quality areas designated pursuant to section 107 as nonattainment for an air pollutant.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H0821841D83E543CE9B2D3CC878EF4FD4"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Limitation
                        Funds awarded under this section shall not be used by any recipient or subrecipient to purchase or install zero-emission port equipment or technology that will not be located at, or directly serve, the one or more ports involved.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HA68A1D1330C44E26B009F23158784042"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Administration of funds
                        Of the funds made available by this section, the Administrator shall reserve 2 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HFD8AB6B3BE9148A883931EE036873D85"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Definitions
                        In this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE68AA90509AB4D15BB8101A8742AB75D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Eligible recipient
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible recipient means—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H08F7794F582B4FE7AC797B7983C63C0D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a port authority;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBFC95F6D496C42F79A6B03388E6C7B54"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              a State, regional, local, or Tribal agency that has jurisdiction over a port authority or a port;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7CA6466F2F634670BF949BD54336EF2C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              an air pollution control agency; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF9C2A081FA7F416AABC3938B4EE638A4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              a private entity that—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H729BC7782DED454F82C27568C76C4562"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 applies for a grant under this section in partnership with an entity described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (C); and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBD7F9DB319454E718CC9F49FA17BC083"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 owns, operates, or uses the facilities, cargo-handling equipment, transportation equipment, or related technology of a port.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4A7AF3F1CD7D464EBEF135414FA6E156"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Greenhouse gas
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H54B13A7F5384418B95478B558F2731F8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Qualified climate action plan
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">qualified climate action plan means a detailed and strategic plan that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBFD974C6107E4731A172476259BB74C4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              establishes goals, implementation strategies, and accounting and inventory practices to reduce emissions at one or more ports of—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7E8A1B97006E4665AE27D6044DF6E451"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 greenhouse gases;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H351E88CAF78543D8B211303A3E67F881"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 an air pollutant that is listed pursuant to section 108(a) (or any precursor to such an air pollutant); and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1F0A8173F32D42EF90DDFB01BB9020ED"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 hazardous air pollutants;
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H39AF741D367C43EC832646F83D172449"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              includes a strategy to collaborate with, communicate with, and address potential effects on low-income and disadvantaged near-port communities and other stakeholders that may be affected by implementation of the plan; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0111F76A6B3944059BF9BB6B77BE755A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              describes how an eligible recipient has implemented or will implement measures to increase the resilience of the one or more ports involved.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDF91F7FC929C4EE08040A9FB7D8337F5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Zero-emission port equipment or technology
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">zero-emission port equipment or technology means human-operated equipment or human-maintained technology that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF1E45F4EC1DF42D59F914FAE7A3AEC57"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              produces zero emissions of any air pollutant that is listed pursuant to section 108(a) (or any precursor to such an air pollutant) and any greenhouse gas other than water vapor; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6003793418C649308D2D83F164211B2A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              captures 100 percent of the emissions described in subparagraph (A) that are produced by an ocean-going vessel at berth.
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H107A90AEBDD1451A9458CA13295D6381"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60103.
               GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION FUND
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 133 of such Act, as added by section 60102 of this Act, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H3BD1D6C56684448B8839F84B0A434AC4"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF2AB4C82603A4965A2AFD29DB7A3414E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     134.
                     GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION FUND
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H218EB79BDD4E4500AE1C234166813FC7"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriations
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC9E3A136B77B4002BEF12E97484D9B47"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Zero-emission technologies
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $7,000,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2024, to make grants, on a competitive basis and beginning not later than 180 calendar days after the date of enactment of this section, to States, municipalities, Tribal governments, and eligible recipients for the purposes of providing grants, loans, or other forms of financial assistance, as well as technical assistance, to enable low-income and disadvantaged communities to deploy or benefit from zero-emission technologies, including distributed technologies on residential rooftops, and to carry out other greenhouse gas emission reduction activities, as determined appropriate by the Administrator in accordance with this section.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC6FE95527777445D8B079CCF8504FA36"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           General assistance
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $11,970,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2024, to make grants, on a competitive basis and beginning not later than 180 calendar days after the date of enactment of this section, to eligible recipients for the purposes of providing financial assistance and technical assistance in accordance with subsection (b).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H46A1492D05B64F8BA65856BA212BDBE0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Low-income and disadvantaged communities
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $8,000,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2024, to make grants, on a competitive basis and beginning not later than 180 calendar days after the date of enactment of this section, to eligible recipients for the purposes of providing financial assistance and technical assistance in low-income and disadvantaged communities in accordance with subsection (b).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3BC9AE6C572C49F19C171EA86076FEB8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Administrative costs
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $30,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the administrative costs necessary to carry out activities under this section.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H046A44C5364B470EA34FECB6F07E0B36"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Use of funds
                        An eligible recipient that receives a grant pursuant to subsection (a) shall use the grant in accordance with the following:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE9EA5455D20A460E930FD9FC44D12FD6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Direct investment
                           The eligible recipient shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H53FEDD88D59E4FD78AA2EB312F53F8BF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              provide financial assistance to qualified projects at the national, regional, State, and local levels;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H342649FD790C4951A2C9BC1E4067ABB5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              prioritize investment in qualified projects that would otherwise lack access to financing; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2E1B884EF90542598765F44B8CAE8955"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              retain, manage, recycle, and monetize all repayments and other revenue received from fees, interest, repaid loans, and all other types of financial assistance provided using grant funds under this section to ensure continued operability.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB0A72B0C5C9B47E9968F071DBC34BD20"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Indirect investment
                           The eligible recipient shall provide funding and technical assistance to establish new or support existing public, quasi-public, not-for-profit, or nonprofit entities that provide financial assistance to qualified projects at the State, local, territorial, or Tribal level or in the District of Columbia, including community- and low-income-focused lenders and capital providers.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3A2CB2B7E35A490F9EBF525C60BB7773"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Definitions
                        In this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H30223886E03C4925985CBB5E31C2F2B6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Eligible recipient
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible recipient means a nonprofit organization that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H837422BC9CF14776BB2E22F0CFB7652A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              is designed to provide capital, leverage private capital, and provide other forms of financial assistance for the rapid deployment of low- and zero-emission products, technologies, and services;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6C06FD6245D4436DB2893AECA110D37B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              does not take deposits other than deposits from repayments and other revenue received from financial assistance provided using grant funds under this section;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H890C868CC64B46319D37B080CE640F5A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              is funded by public or charitable contributions; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC369D554A75148C7B138F50BCFA28AEE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              invests in or finances projects alone or in conjunction with other investors.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC56892A9F71B40588915BB1E79064C83"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Greenhouse gas
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7104A07F785A4CA784E2C53B810C53C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Qualified project
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">qualified project includes any project, activity, or technology that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB01311C4F571453BADCB22C73F33B0CE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              reduces or avoids greenhouse gas emissions and other forms of air pollution in partnership with, and by leveraging investment from, the private sector; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0E24BE2002904367B284FD3DD19FC335"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              assists communities in the efforts of those communities to reduce or avoid greenhouse gas emissions and other forms of air pollution.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0F866E96B6424F2DB149AF72D687A454"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Zero-emission technology
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">zero-emission technology means any technology that produces zero emissions of—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA3063F8B549741C5930122A88B8D022D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              any air pollutant that is listed pursuant to section 108(a) (or any precursor to such an air pollutant); and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD1C1B8C9019F4B219E8AAA5ED7ED1371"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              any greenhouse gas.
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H21AD4A9C46AC44749B57DDAFBF6E1BE0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60104.
               DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCD73F53A5080440FA6A7222B66B6862B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Goods movement
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $60,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants, rebates, and loans under section 792 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16132) to identify and reduce diesel emissions resulting from goods movement facilities, and vehicles servicing goods movement facilities, in low-income and disadvantaged communities to address the health impacts of such emissions on such communities.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H83CCE3925A0146A4B43219E2C67D5AFD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Administrative costs
                  The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall reserve 2 percent of the amounts made available under this section for the administrative costs necessary to carry out activities pursuant to this section.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC46C1C94FC1E4FB3A2F96BDD35B9F169"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60105.
               FUNDING TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD133F124DDB640A5A8E0D9FB48983B1D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Fenceline air monitoring and screening air monitoring
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $117,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405) to deploy, integrate, support, and maintain fenceline air monitoring, screening air monitoring, national air toxics trend stations, and other air toxics and community monitoring.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H517CEA9B8DAA41E189408E9DB9627D64"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Multipollutant monitoring stations
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $50,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H52DCF2635F974F938858F2BF591732C9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     to expand the national ambient air quality monitoring network with new multipollutant monitoring stations; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2C0CD4BE6EBF45AABF9F36AD8A71FF9A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to replace, repair, operate, and maintain existing monitors.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H28ADE46FCD8F4E6F9FC5DDBA3C7B0D8A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Air quality sensors in low-income and disadvantaged communities
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405) to deploy, integrate, and operate air quality sensors in low-income and disadvantaged communities.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAB9E8EB549D4410CA003186D9AAF8270"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Emissions from wood heaters
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $15,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405) for testing and other agency activities to address emissions from wood heaters.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H72FC294AE99E4FC29957CFE0B4FC9FA8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Methane monitoring
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $20,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405) for monitoring emissions of methane.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1BDEC9240A2B4CD086E789C909A676AC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Clean Air Act grants
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $25,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 and section 105 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c), 7405).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0D12FB720F16463CA1BC1FDA192F5247"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Greenhouse gas and zero-emission standards for mobile sources
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to provide grants to States to adopt and implement greenhouse gas and zero-emission standards for mobile sources pursuant to section 177 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7507).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H19661BDA45A949C8BBCA4FC34B9B1F7E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HED6FF9A8E8E34340A3632C80019F4A8B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60106.
               FUNDING TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION AT SCHOOLS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD9A9B53145E846958C8937CF7F5E1C4F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $37,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants and other activities to monitor and reduce greenhouse gas emissions and other air pollutants at schools in low-income and disadvantaged communities under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c)) and section 105 of that Act (42 U.S.C. 7405).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H13E4BBD6B146492AA6322D74C1375C0A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Technical assistance
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $12,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for providing technical assistance to schools in low-income and disadvantaged communities under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7403(a)–(c)) and section 105 of that Act (42 U.S.C. 7405)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB5F21CCEA01E49158F90C2C00F7AE100"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     to address environmental issues;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7EBA77DB3D814536A5279E1E9A34B3E0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to develop school environmental quality plans that include standards for school building, design, construction, and renovation; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE11C13A930FD40BF88A51BF386B65EB5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     to identify and mitigate ongoing air pollution hazards.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5DF8A7634EAE4773AA63325C4C7AAFE7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H354F67B20A3D4784B3300CA3E665917C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60107.
               LOW EMISSIONS ELECTRICITY PROGRAM
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 134 of such Act, as added by section 60103 of this Act, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H97C3DA8E8062418889B33184E1A0F11B"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDB0562262907449586DFE2E7896AFF5D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     135.
                     LOW EMISSIONS ELECTRICITY PROGRAM
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H635E70D1944D45DC9BED3ACA72986AA6"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriation
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until September 30, 2031—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0D68713D21884570AEDCBDD2429B18DC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           $17,000,000 for consumer-related education and partnerships with respect to reductions in greenhouse gas emissions that result from domestic electricity generation and use;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE66FA534228049359E6BD11D8B1AE98D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           $17,000,000 for education, technical assistance, and partnerships within low-income and disadvantaged communities with respect to reductions in greenhouse gas emissions that result from domestic electricity generation and use;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H879B528D127545AEB9BB501F7F6B9731"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           $17,000,000 for industry-related outreach, technical assistance, and partnerships with respect to reductions in greenhouse gas emissions that result from domestic electricity generation and use;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDF1B4DB36E264A77AD6ECC926FC68ED5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           $17,000,000 for outreach and technical assistance to, and partnerships with, State, Tribal, and local governments with respect to reductions in greenhouse gas emissions that result from domestic electricity generation and use;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HECA5233D11C44E569A00865C1520FA43"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           $1,000,000 to assess, not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this section, the reductions in greenhouse gas emissions that result from changes in domestic electricity generation and use that are anticipated to occur on an annual basis through fiscal year 2031; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
