                                    id="H10B30EE6E71847DC90617208813FA313"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           $18,000,000 to ensure that reductions in greenhouse gas emissions are achieved through use of the existing authorities of this Act, incorporating the assessment under paragraph (5).
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3707AD7950CB413E929F01614237CBEC"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Administration of Funds
                        Of the amounts made available under subsection (a), the Administrator shall reserve 2 percent for the administrative costs necessary to carry out activities pursuant to that subsection.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H9C44AAB74EE34E8DA27C32856B60FF56"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Definition of greenhouse gas
                        In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB889A7F80EEA4289A87147C8476A7871"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60108.
               FUNDING FOR SECTION 211(O) OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFBA273D82C284B029297DF439C38CB96"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Test and protocol development
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to carry out section 211(o) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)) with respect to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5D1D27203BA346DFBF3FC6D3BA2FED70"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the development and establishment of tests and protocols regarding the environmental and public health effects of a fuel or fuel additive;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7AC46CDBFE7A49E38B54865A3ACE6F52"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     internal and extramural data collection and analyses to regularly update applicable regulations, guidance, and procedures for determining lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions of a fuel; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H86A1C7289695464D9D51832B7DBF9DEC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the review, analysis, and evaluation of the impacts of all transportation fuels, including fuel lifecycle implications, on the general public and on low-income and disadvantaged communities.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC104969AD8404C148D965731DA17900B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Investments in advanced biofuels
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $10,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for new grants to industry and other related activities under section 211(o) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)) to support investments in advanced biofuels.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBBB0E2EC2746490989F974C393F5CF3F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H33E2B1004F874417B27687D67AE6BF44"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60109.
               FUNDING FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AMERICAN INNOVATION AND MANUFACTURING ACT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0CA94047729C464E88F627C246E11FA6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriations
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAA572C4C379C45B7ABBF29867B40683A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $20,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to carry out subsections (a) through (i) and subsection (k) of section 103 of division S of Public Law 116–260 (42 U.S.C. 7675).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H22E03C18FB4E432982396DED12E7F368"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Implementation and compliance tools
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to deploy new implementation and compliance tools to carry out subsections (a) through (i) and subsection (k) of section 103 of division S of Public Law 116–260 (42 U.S.C. 7675).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB810456FC5E84035A2C6D57613A303C9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Competitive grants
                     In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $15,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for competitive grants for reclaim and innovative destruction technologies under subsections (a) through (i) and subsection (k) of section 103 of division S of Public Law 116–260 (42 U.S.C. 7675).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8DACB6F8819D4715B01F9A5F42316848"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Administration of funds
                  Of the funds made available pursuant to subsection (a)(3), the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall reserve 5 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out activities pursuant to such subsection.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFF9CCF90AFCF489A839248AEAEE9EC78"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60110.
               FUNDING FOR ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND PUBLIC INFORMATION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC4A45F26773547409A693EFC94779094"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Compliance monitoring
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $18,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to update the Integrated Compliance Information System of the Environmental Protection Agency and any associated systems, necessary information technology infrastructure, or public access software tools to ensure access to compliance data and related information.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H162B83AF210547C38C6362189421D7F1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Communications with ICIS
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for grants to States, Indian tribes, and air pollution control agencies (as such terms are defined in section 302 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7602)) to update their systems to ensure communication with the Integrated Compliance Information System of the Environmental Protection Agency and any associated systems.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H714CAF758786471C86D715B7F8043361"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Inspection software
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $4,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H111631F3E5C94DDFB12CEF8608F85A2C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     to acquire or update inspection software for use by the Environmental Protection Agency, States, Indian tribes, and air pollution control agencies (as such terms are defined in section 302 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7602)); or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA0B357AF4ACE4049BA536D73993B4123"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to acquire necessary devices on which to run such inspection software.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HEB001AE6C42246599A583C4EA992A1EA"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60111.
               GREENHOUSE GAS CORPORATE REPORTING
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4C4428053B914BF396DDD2106C330665"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the Environmental Protection Agency to support—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC835B025ADF0437280D313986865F093"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     enhanced standardization and transparency of corporate climate action commitments and plans to reduce greenhouse gas emissions;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H87BF9BFD29F245B1A35454DE31C37D3D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     enhanced transparency regarding progress toward meeting such commitments and implementing such plans; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3DF9EE8C58024569A9B0A4AA55845668"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     progress toward meeting such commitments and implementing such plans.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF569B3E44FE04043B64A23DE17F96737"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HAF68A430ABD04EA99B8FDD19E45063EE"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60112.
               ENVIRONMENTAL PRODUCT DECLARATION ASSISTANCE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA1BEFFAFA02A4F7F854F69B0A844D983"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to develop and carry out a program to support the development, enhanced standardization and transparency, and reporting criteria for environmental product declarations that include measurements of the embodied greenhouse gas emissions of the material or product associated with all relevant stages of production, use, and disposal, and conform with international standards, for construction materials and products by—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6CD9B197D44D465BBE1C73D3ABFB8275"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     providing grants to businesses that manufacture construction materials and products for developing and verifying environmental product declarations, and to States, Indian Tribes, and nonprofit organizations that will support such businesses;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H93A30C4733924FDA8716713D27C203F1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     providing technical assistance to businesses that manufacture construction materials and products in developing and verifying environmental product declarations, and to States, Indian Tribes, and nonprofit organizations that will support such businesses; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCADEFD80D13941309A7D8A0D233F4DB4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     carrying out other activities that assist in measuring, reporting, and steadily reducing the quantity of embodied carbon of construction materials and products.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7E8A2B7170E4494FB7545B92E2461BA9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Administrative costs
                  Of the amounts made available under this section, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall reserve 5 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7E88114A8CB949638E7ABC4F5D30DC3A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7A376F0BE1864BC1A2877C545E949C0A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Greenhouse gas
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H895A0E758BA8482F9BDE6967C8867598"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     State
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">State has the meaning given to that term in section 302(d) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7602(d)).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD5D377237F1647EDB6DC34402F949D97"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60113.
               METHANE EMISSIONS REDUCTION PROGRAM
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 135 of such Act, as added by section 60107 of this Act, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HCCF06CC78A404C8891C5BC8E924CB9D9"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF63A592F402948EB96EA2E537FF8E238"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     136.
                     METHANE EMISSIONS AND WASTE REDUCTION INCENTIVE PROGRAM FOR PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS SYSTEMS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HFD5B2CDD910746878D57145803BE4B82"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Incentives for methane mitigation and monitoring
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $850,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1BDC21378BBE489A8321C0E8C33737C3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           for grants, rebates, contracts, loans, and other activities of the Environmental Protection Agency for the purposes of providing financial and technical assistance to owners and operators of applicable facilities to prepare and submit greenhouse gas reports under subpart W of part 98 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA0E5A7B428F147A5AFCD2242A46FC5E4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           for grants, rebates, contracts, loans, and other activities of the Environmental Protection Agency authorized under subsections (a) through (c) of section 103 for methane emissions monitoring;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H921BB498822D40DEAB186C6213131B66"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           for grants, rebates, contracts, loans, and other activities of the Environmental Protection Agency for the purposes of providing financial and technical assistance to reduce methane and other greenhouse gas emissions from petroleum and natural gas systems, mitigate legacy air pollution from petroleum and natural gas systems, and provide funding for—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1677922B9EE4431A97EC70378616E43A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              improving climate resiliency of communities and petroleum and natural gas systems;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H33D73F8B80704A019BFC9273F97CC805"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              improving and deploying industrial equipment and processes that reduce methane and other greenhouse gas emissions and waste;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA72524FA79EA4D88B49C3261A987875D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              supporting innovation in reducing methane and other greenhouse gas emissions and waste from petroleum and natural gas systems;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H44ADCFC06E744AE09F1E2D30BAD59092"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              permanently shutting in and plugging wells on non-Federal land;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H691F30EAACDF40CAB3879FF3190C20E5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              mitigating health effects of methane and other greenhouse gas emissions, and legacy air pollution from petroleum and natural gas systems in low-income and disadvantaged communities; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H01EDEDFCEF3C4D78833CD17EA8605C56"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              supporting environmental restoration; and
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD040450913D8481692C260E29ED8B9A9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           to cover all direct and indirect costs required to administer this section, prepare inventories, gather empirical data, and track emissions.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H52AF5505A15343998022A85440468013"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Incentives for Methane Mitigation from Conventional Wells
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $700,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028, for activities described in paragraphs (1) through (4) of subsection (a) at marginal conventional wells.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H14FBA4C689C64FBFAAC3223D17DF3250"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Waste emissions charge
                        The Administrator shall impose and collect a charge on methane emissions that exceed an applicable waste emissions threshold under subsection (f) from an owner or operator of an applicable facility that reports more than 25,000 metric tons of carbon dioxide equivalent of greenhouse gases emitted per year pursuant to subpart W of part 98 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, regardless of the reporting threshold under that subpart.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HAB688D307B8D4AE4B777FF815DBE6AD0"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Applicable facility
                        For purposes of this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">applicable facility means a facility within the following industry segments, as defined in subpart W of part 98 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA05908DCFAC5400A906DB5ECAA91A404"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Offshore petroleum and natural gas production.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD4E161075F3D4BEB984368FF400F3D65"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Onshore petroleum and natural gas production.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6C8C43390AD147EDB3622A68C09ECBD6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Onshore natural gas processing.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H64DFAC42607A4958A7D5EB9166C7FADF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Onshore natural gas transmission compression.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7CB4FF992CCA41EC8F307BCEC1724CBB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Underground natural gas storage.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H76CB7471A2484D14B66230513549383C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Liquefied natural gas storage.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE8A5BD43595846D9BC7113C31D79BC51"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (7)
                           Liquefied natural gas import and export equipment.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF385887CE5D640A5B827FA87787B1095"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (8)
                           Onshore petroleum and natural gas gathering and boosting.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H49EA87DC8699470280353733746919BE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (9)
                           Onshore natural gas transmission pipeline.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HAE00948954A9482BB8284BBD7C415D24"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (e)
                        Charge Amount
                        The amount of a charge under subsection (c) for an applicable facility shall be equal to the product obtained by multiplying—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDD93C1F29B4A4395A871DBCA45006893"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           the number of metric tons of methane emissions reported pursuant to subpart W of part 98 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, for the applicable facility that exceed the applicable annual waste emissions threshold listed in subsection (f) during the previous reporting period; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCC7EFCADD7C541888E8756093249C39F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H669506EF19994E68BE4F26FD02E5FD34"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              $900 for emissions reported for calendar year 2024;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDDE4F074EF364D01A4F8603E058A1439"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              $1,200 for emissions reported for calendar year 2025; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2F86D1AE62594DF99CD4DA2B03FC77FF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              $1,500 for emissions reported for calendar year 2026 and each year thereafter.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H34FC3E7E81684A6AA534161880C9F3BD"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (f)
                        Waste emissions threshold
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCE296025C47B419AA870752224715DFB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Petroleum and natural gas production
                           With respect to imposing and collecting the charge under subsection (c) for an applicable facility in an industry segment listed in paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (d), the Administrator shall impose and collect the charge on the reported metric tons of methane emissions from such facility that exceed—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEE1C9D3E2BE9416BAE48334AAF23417F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              0.20 percent of the natural gas sent to sale from such facility; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAE1A8314A335427AA3F64AB7B5C2742F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              10 metric tons of methane per million barrels of oil sent to sale from such facility, if such facility sent no natural gas to sale.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7EAC1F6736EC4E77BA9347F1E2BA6149"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Nonproduction petroleum and natural gas systems
                           With respect to imposing and collecting the charge under subsection (c) for an applicable facility in an industry segment listed in paragraph (3), (6), (7), or (8) of subsection (d), the Administrator shall impose and collect the charge on the reported metric tons of methane emissions that exceed 0.05 percent of the natural gas sent to sale from or through such facility.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC5E797488D1447888A457D4BF5BA3064"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Natural gas transmission
                           With respect to imposing and collecting the charge under subsection (c) for an applicable facility in an industry segment listed in paragraph (4), (5), or (9) of subsection (d), the Administrator shall impose and collect the charge on the reported metric tons of methane emissions that exceed 0.11 percent of the natural gas sent to sale from or through such facility.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8871F0B8E05945DDB0F9C8D78C942289"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Common Ownership or Control
                           In calculating the total emissions charge obligation for facilities under common ownership or control, the Administrator shall allow for the netting of emissions by reducing the total obligation to account for facility emissions levels that are below the applicable thresholds within and across all applicable segments identified in subsection (d). 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4AB717A7EDED45C1A532C3A1B19D7B28"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Exemption
                           Charges shall not be imposed pursuant to paragraph (1) on emissions that exceed the waste emissions threshold specified in such paragraph if such emissions are caused by unreasonable delay, as determined by the Administrator, in environmental permitting of gathering or transmission infrastructure necessary for offtake of increased volume as a result of methane emissions mitigation implementation.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H98F3499D859945E48FE64CBC50F25D56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Exemption for regulatory compliance
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7F100F60E1A9461892D02FA337209D71"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              Charges shall not be imposed pursuant to subsection (c) on an applicable facility that is subject to and in compliance with methane emissions requirements pursuant to subsections (b) and (d) of section 111 upon a determination by the Administrator that—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB2EFD54A6C9E436FBE768A053D633229"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 methane emissions standards and plans pursuant to subsections (b) and (d) of section 111 have been approved and are in effect in all States with respect to the applicable facilities; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8C317E1C90C0445F825C6A7B3162805C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 compliance with the requirements described in clause (i) will result in equivalent or greater emissions reductions as would be achieved by the proposed rule of the Administrator entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">Standards of Performance for New, Reconstructed, and Modified Sources and Emissions Guidelines for Existing Sources: Oil and Natural Gas Sector Climate Review (86 Fed. Reg. 63110 (November 15, 2021)), if such rule had been finalized and implemented.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H708EC80EA54A46F9A9C72C4B7198E1DC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Resumption of charge
                              If the conditions in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (A) cease to apply after the Administrator has made the determination in that subparagraph, the applicable facility will again be subject to the charge under subsection (c) beginning in the first calendar year in which the conditions in either clause (i) or (ii) of that subparagraph are no longer met.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3836E48B6E6D4DF9A459343A52645083"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (7)
                           Plugged wells
                           Charges shall not be imposed with respect to the emissions rate from any well that has been permanently shut-in and plugged in the previous year in accordance with all applicable closure requirements, as determined by the Administrator. 
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H9697D08416D44AC39994FC52A3B807D4"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (g)
                        Period
                        The charge under subsection (c) shall be imposed and collected beginning with respect to emissions reported for calendar year 2024 and for each year thereafter.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H85514DC442C54F57862D25E3CB31CEF7"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (h)
                        Reporting
                        Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall revise the requirements of subpart W of part 98 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, to ensure the reporting under such subpart, and calculation of charges under subsections (e) and (f) of this section, are based on empirical data, including data collected pursuant to subsection (a)(4), accurately reflect the total methane emissions and waste emissions from the applicable facilities, and allow owners and operators of applicable facilities to submit empirical emissions data, in a manner to be prescribed by the Administrator, to demonstrate the extent to which a charge under subsection (c) is owed.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H6851412BDDDB469A93F919C8E4317E41"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Definition of greenhouse gas
                        In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H281E96E8EA864E4481BC0BC55CB73162"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60114.
               CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION GRANTS
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 136 of such Act, as added by section 60113 of this Act, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HB04165CEF69945689068E84BA7D77AF4"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0D6F957C7B754A3E9EC08D8E265D5585"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     137.
                     GREENHOUSE GAS AIR POLLUTION PLANS AND IMPLEMENTATION GRANTS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H79041DD441114FBA95452BBA68C8C225"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriations
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2966FB87493D4BE9ABE5D80C1B3AD56E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Greenhouse gas air pollution planning grants
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any amounts in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to carry out subsection (b).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H408F363B80A54D3ABD3A8D7F66C4AF55"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Greenhouse gas air pollution implementation grants
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any amounts in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $4,750,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to carry out subsection (c).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8A697B3BC0A34133948772A22AF2CF7F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Administrative costs
                           Of the funds made available under paragraph (2), the Administrator shall reserve 3 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section, to provide technical assistance to eligible entities, to develop a plan that could be used as a model by grantees in developing a plan under subsection (b), and to model the effects of plans described in this section.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H2A26D57155C844129B08AC2566FA1C88"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Greenhouse gas air pollution planning grants
                        The Administrator shall make a grant to at least one eligible entity in each State for the costs of developing a plan for the reduction of greenhouse gas air pollution to be submitted with an application for a grant under subsection (c). Each such plan shall include programs, policies, measures, and projects that will achieve or facilitate the reduction of greenhouse gas air pollution. Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall publish a funding opportunity announcement for grants under this subsection. 
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H5AE73AEF504940118FF834898A7AE1A3"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Greenhouse gas air pollution reduction implementation grants
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2F0D121BA8B64A768717FB0F5963CE59"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall competitively award grants to eligible entities to implement plans developed under subsection (b).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6733FFD15BED4A35A4CA5E32A985CA3A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Application
                           To apply for a grant under this subsection, an eligible entity shall submit to the Administrator an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Administrator shall require, which such application shall include information regarding the degree to which greenhouse gas air pollution is projected to be reduced in total and with respect to low-income and disadvantaged communities.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF9E39207AA724F66BAE1ED41CEE96A94"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Terms and conditions
                           The Administrator shall make funds available to a grantee under this subsection in such amounts, upon such a schedule, and subject to such conditions based on its performance in implementing its plan submitted under this section and in achieving projected greenhouse gas air pollution reduction, as determined by the Administrator. 
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H6B25E181A2D94D529D250B51921B4DDB"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Definitions
                        In this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9A749D3F9E8341DCA24B1CAEC34E4CFF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Eligible entity
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible entity means—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5433D532FA3646539ED30A6832765AC5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a State;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H206C00C6FA67469C9447221BA4C54F43"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              an air pollution control agency;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H26497EB6A58C41E5A56310CE77BF3B12"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              a municipality;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H16C02548E6EC4294B5254EBDF07A7680"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              an Indian tribe; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEC2290BCB5B147A1B6C12D76C3BBE619"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              a group of one or more entities listed in subparagraphs (A) through (D).
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDA70582BC9124E6D8391EC6F0B4C5B83"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Greenhouse gas
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H876792DBEF0A4C549E25E5345F5B2307"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60115.
               ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY EFFICIENT, ACCURATE, AND TIMELY REVIEWS
                In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $40,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to provide for the development of efficient, accurate, and timely reviews for permitting and approval processes through the hiring and training of personnel, the development of programmatic documents, the procurement of technical or scientific services for reviews, the development of environmental data or information systems, stakeholder and community engagement, the purchase of new equipment for environmental analysis, and the development of geographic information systems and other analysis tools, techniques, and guidance to improve agency transparency, accountability, and public engagement.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H32E5EC1896AE4278906CD206E01E6051"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60116.
               LOW-EMBODIED CARBON LABELING FOR CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE0648B7129FF441987C33D7CE3DDB9CC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for necessary administrative costs of the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to carry out this section and to develop and carry out a program, in consultation with the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration for construction materials used in transportation projects and the Administrator of General Services for construction materials used for Federal buildings, to identify and label construction materials and products that have substantially lower levels of embodied greenhouse gas emissions associated with all relevant stages of production, use, and disposal, as compared to estimated industry averages of similar materials or products, as determined by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, based on— 
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8CB16D5066284294BA448A87DCE87AC0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     environmental product declarations; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7489C5C05E454D6B85A8D089C39F3A8E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     determinations by State agencies, as verified by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H85C46863DD4E465E8242395BCAED9EA9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.

            Hazardous Materials
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"

               60201.
               ENVIRONMENTAL AND CLIMATE JUSTICE BLOCK GRANTS
               The Clean Air Act is amended by inserting after section 137, as added by subtitle A of this title, the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H58FC4F041FAD4C82B5482AADDE5D5392"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8B994DA68C2B4E38873C7A604E8D7EBB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     138.
                     ENVIRONMENTAL AND CLIMATE JUSTICE BLOCK GRANTS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H49320AF30EC84C2DB4E43870A5602D38"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Appropriation
                        In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8632BEDA772C4BD6B00F3AA835ABEBAB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           $2,800,000,000 to remain available until September 30, 2026, to award grants for the activities described in subsection (b); and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1DAA2BEBB69E4FCA90626D65CC187BCF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           $200,000,000 to remain available until September 30, 2026, to provide technical assistance to eligible entities related to grants awarded under this section.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HDF2877265FFE4CC6ABA9CBB43D10FB20"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Grants
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7989C3EA01ED4E66B53A26C1404FA910"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall use amounts made available under subsection (a)(1) to award grants for periods of up to 3 years to eligible entities to carry out activities described in paragraph (2) that benefit disadvantaged communities, as defined by the Administrator. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H22EF0575ADF04F9F9636825D864983B9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Eligible activities
                           An eligible entity may use a grant awarded under this subsection for—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5629F4E6110A4CA8BC46A07C294C946D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              community-led air and other pollution monitoring, prevention, and remediation, and investments in low- and zero-emission and resilient technologies and related infrastructure and workforce development that help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and other air pollutants;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB1C58563593143E1B8372926E870AE5F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              mitigating climate and health risks from urban heat islands, extreme heat, wood heater emissions, and wildfire events;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC3D8F878533241D0B87D9C9A1501D72C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              climate resiliency and adaptation;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9F279BACC0F242E199C4C12A4E192FE2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              reducing indoor toxics and indoor air pollution; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC716B3B81DAD4243BDA24DC15B5FAAC1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              facilitating engagement of disadvantaged communities in State and Federal advisory groups, workshops, rulemakings, and other public processes.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9BB582B82137462FA7473AD856DE63D3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Eligible entities
                           In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">eligible entity means—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0D0E66D84A90481AB1A049457EBDEC21"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a partnership between—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H192F81866A5943F39F665562B0F93C24"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 an Indian tribe, a local government, or an institution of higher education; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA53AED7617C642CEAC60B98944D223D2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 a community-based nonprofit organization;
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6CCE5E25BCB04E8396C27FD01E297EDC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              a community-based nonprofit organization; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H581D4A5E6E4B420A8C2542014CFB0805"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              a partnership of community-based nonprofit organizations.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HBF37D54CF9894EBCAF691B5C7BEA1CE2"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Administrative costs
                        The Administrator shall reserve 7 percent of the amounts made available under subsection (a) for administrative costs to carry out this section.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H4D1999797784490C956DF528DE054ECB"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Definition of greenhouse gas
                        In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H7D2FBB975D6441FC86801E8C86453665"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            C
            United States Fish and Wildlife Service
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HBEFC64F9E3AF4A5E87F752FA3EBA0B1A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60301.
               ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT RECOVERY PLANS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the United States Fish and Wildlife Service for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $125,000,000, to remain available until expended, for the purposes of developing and implementing recovery plans under paragraphs (1), (3), and (4) of subsection (f) of section 4 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1533(f)).
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2C232F54825A47CD9EB2E12A5E192D0C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60302.
               FUNDING FOR THE UNITED STATES FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE TO ADDRESS WEATHER EVENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCAB321A3554B4172A57EA07C417B4298"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the United States Fish and Wildlife Service for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $121,250,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to make direct expenditures, award grants, and enter into contracts and cooperative agreements for the purposes of rebuilding and restoring units of the National Wildlife Refuge System and State wildlife management areas by—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H845B0F53E81448C78565F41614FE84F2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     addressing the threat of invasive species;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H79FE97452D8343F99BAB0DC4D874C4D9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     increasing the resiliency and capacity of habitats and infrastructure to withstand weather events; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDA88EDCB94B048FD995C4100D6DC2D3E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     reducing the amount of damage caused by weather events.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HACB4C2C6B1E34F169FFF9C9DBC3AF1FD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Administrative costs
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the United States Fish and Wildlife Service for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $3,750,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for necessary administrative expenses associated with carrying out this section.
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H589D77845BC749FE9ECE86DE1FD4B4C5"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            D
            Council on Environmental Quality
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4A5E85A311FC462B9903F03F1E149AA0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60401.
               ENVIRONMENTAL AND CLIMATE DATA COLLECTION
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Chair of the Council on Environmental Quality for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $32,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE05ADC22A2214C4F8371CCC8045D4C10"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  to support data collection efforts relating to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H03555178E46E45918CD6D5952F92E3E6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     disproportionate negative environmental harms and climate impacts; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HED8B6B1CF0744C6185F3978899782DAF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     cumulative impacts of pollution and temperature rise;
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB1D80B4F43274697AEBFFBF3D9D79C8E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  to establish, expand, and maintain efforts to track disproportionate burdens and cumulative impacts and provide academic and workforce support for analytics and informatics infrastructure and data collection systems; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HEEE88CDCA5464C079429015835003C71"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  to support efforts to ensure that any mapping or screening tool is accessible to community-based organizations and community members.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3D257FC499D74EEABF569D40C9F97E07"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60402.
               COUNCIL ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Chair of the Council on Environmental Quality for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $30,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to carry out the Council on Environmental Quality’s functions and for the purposes of training personnel, developing programmatic environmental documents, and developing tools, guidance, and techniques to improve stakeholder and community engagement. 
            
         
         <subtitle id="H56F8C2851A4E43B897253C117A999F9C"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            E
            Transportation and Infrastructure
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H0C1FF99A953E4B76838BCA283D97AA86"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60501.
               NEIGHBORHOOD ACCESS AND EQUITY GRANT PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0117DEA3FBCD4BB586C0D8F54CE3BBD3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H5EF76814FB57479C8B1A312CB53046C8"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HA976E42445CC45AAB8184BB4DE6C32B0"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        177.
                        NEIGHBORHOOD ACCESS AND EQUITY GRANT PROGRAM
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H5BFD768352C947478975A5BDFD056D0C"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In General
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $1,893,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration for competitive grants to eligible entities described in subsection (b)—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H25175DF6FBA248458C87B2CA02296933"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              to improve walkability, safety, and affordable transportation access through projects that are context-sensitive—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H76F92CFC531C4E529C98172425851506"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 to remove, remediate, or reuse a facility described in subsection (c)(1);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9D8AFD5D5E914E49AF1BC8707C5A08B1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 to replace a facility described in subsection (c)(1) with a facility that is at-grade or lower speed;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD7A9DDA636AE47C7ABF91FCB3EC69AB2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 to retrofit or cap a facility described in subsection (c)(1);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H974D0E40AA144A4E89E002A52F4A7592"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 to build or improve complete streets, multiuse trails, regional greenways, or active transportation networks and spines; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7D6FE989FAE7440ABADE8352F9A1A160"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 to provide affordable access to essential destinations, public spaces, or transportation links and hubs;
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5CAE42B52C4444CB848589CB945878CB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              to mitigate or remediate negative impacts on the human or natural environment resulting from a facility described in subsection (c)(2) in a disadvantaged or underserved community through—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HED4122CB41AA4BCAAA6A01439B95B451"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 noise barriers to reduce impacts resulting from a facility described in subsection (c)(2);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA7192F027E9E441DB238956722E9EF3F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 technologies, infrastructure, and activities to reduce surface transportation-related greenhouse gas emissions and other air pollution;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H83944AFD32C94AFCA9F47D43426A2C00"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 natural infrastructure, pervious, permeable, or porous pavement, or protective features to reduce or manage stormwater run-off resulting from a facility described in subsection (c)(2);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
