                                             id="H658E59C450A24CD4A7E813852AF75735"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 infrastructure and natural features to reduce or mitigate urban heat island hot spots in the transportation right-of-way or on surface transportation facilities; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE55B04191F784DB3907E2A543E8CFE71"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 safety improvements for vulnerable road users; and
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2DD03FEFF75E4FE6886090F9766107FB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              for planning and capacity building activities in disadvantaged or underserved communities to—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7F9DC8062FE64A389E1160197B0CA106"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 identify, monitor, or assess local and ambient air quality, emissions of transportation greenhouse gases, hot spot areas of extreme heat or elevated air pollution, gaps in tree canopy coverage, or flood prone transportation infrastructure;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H94D12CFAFBD549ADBD07DDB1E395F8C8"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 assess transportation equity or pollution impacts and develop local anti-displacement policies and community benefit agreements;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9E7EC4DA0A5445878ABE11D102CFE332"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 conduct predevelopment activities for projects eligible under this subsection;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6675F9C7BD8A4195958F0A0B588F9325"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 expand public participation in transportation planning by individuals and organizations in disadvantaged or underserved communities; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5BAFAFB03CB84615988991E7CADB6040"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 administer or obtain technical assistance related to activities described in this subsection.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H341C1E602B9C4DCE9967F1F20D3EC268"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Eligible entities described
                           An eligible entity referred to in subsection (a) is—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H55B3D084395E44B69A84D4D26ACA0AF7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              a State;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAAD8441873844914B9BF7D09026D9E27"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              a unit of local government;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEAD89C745F4A435E8ECFADE864E569C8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              a political subdivision of a State;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8F20609483A54252B93E4C6709FE934F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              an entity described in section 207(m)(1)(E);
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H969ADC098B3B45C69B3678F39D074499"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              a territory of the United States;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H85146651611445E298B2D8F35E881C77"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (6)
                              a special purpose district or public authority with a transportation function;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6CC28106E9AA47BA9E25DDF574FA13F5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (7)
                              a metropolitan planning organization (as defined in section 134(b)(2)); or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC143BB051B1E438ABC335F64CEB348EC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (8)
                              with respect to a grant described in subsection (a)(3), in addition to an eligible entity described in paragraphs (1) through (7), a nonprofit organization or institution of higher education that has entered into a partnership with an eligible entity described in paragraphs (1) through (7).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H0E29C42EDE1B4757BA0BE242C18428E7"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Facility described
                           A facility referred to in subsection (a) is—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H57FC6ABB6EA2415DAEBE4A6678479AFC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              a surface transportation facility for which high speeds, grade separation, or other design factors create an obstacle to connectivity within a community; or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7CCBD5590EDC4695A28E7231696B9969"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              a surface transportation facility which is a source of air pollution, noise, stormwater, or other burden to a disadvantaged or underserved community.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H06C76A84F79A4E66B5A88B4371010A70"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Investment in economically disadvantaged communities
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H44AC2AC7537F4823A218BBC26FF0CBF9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $1,262,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration to provide grants for projects in communities described in paragraph (2) for the same purposes and administered in the same manner as described in subsection (a).
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF96C2EBE141D49ECA999243144CD2ECA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Communities described
                              A community referred to in paragraph (1) is a community that—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5EBDA2AFDAC74557BE5620542F647B04"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 is economically disadvantaged, underserved, or located in an area of persistent poverty;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H636BC5A381E443A196FA1941C8CC2D2A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 has entered or will enter into a community benefits agreement with representatives of the community;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H50A6024916654AF8A2410E8F6CD19F47"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 has an anti-displacement policy, a community land trust, or a community advisory board in effect; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H229A0176E7184B50899CB7DABB12E418"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 has demonstrated a plan for employing local residents in the area impacted by the activity or project proposed under this section.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H789B2E92697E41B69F0371B4258BEEDD"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Administration
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA68AB2F1EB9B44078D079C87AF9143B6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              A project carried out under subsection (a) or (d) shall be treated as a project on a Federal-aid highway.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H26CF18E16E984CAB8367D6DCD3DA2978"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Compliance with existing requirements
                              Funds made available for a grant under this section and administered by or through a State department of transportation shall be expended in compliance with the U.S. Department of Transportation’s Disadvantaged Business Enterprise Program.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HEF6BE2992EAB4BD099ACCC66F33AE6B9"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Cost share
                           The Federal share of the cost of an activity carried out using a grant awarded under this section shall be not more than 80 percent, except that the Federal share of the cost of a project in a disadvantaged or underserved community may be up to 100 percent.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HFBB2CF73C7254006BBD65BDFB3D4ABCD"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Technical assistance
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $50,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration for—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H420CF5270D04471B82D29F5D99AB49A4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              guidance, technical assistance, templates, training, or tools to facilitate efficient and effective contracting, design, and project delivery by units of local government;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H61F29A985C764BCA843B9AE6E11FF50E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              subgrants to units of local government to build capacity of such units of local government to assume responsibilities to deliver surface transportation projects; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H472F140F66DB4907BE3C45983A986A8E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              operations and administration of the Federal Highway Administration.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HC897B8E6781C469FA27A5D5DA9A21C97"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (h)
                           Limitations
                           Amounts made available under this section shall not—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H109796DA15444609944FD80673037635"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              be subject to any restriction or limitation on the total amount of funds available for implementation or execution of programs authorized for Federal-aid highways; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H65570256C2C944D895B78AF7E1F3BDA6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              be used for a project for additional through travel lanes for single-occupant passenger vehicles.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8A0301B9231745D68D556CE9F8256F4F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H5E6B5B24F9B34D23B90641A1571464A1"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        177. Neighborhood access and equity grant program.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H36BCD30E88BB428386334D632B3A2155"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60502.
               ASSISTANCE FOR FEDERAL BUILDINGS
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $250,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to be deposited in the Federal Buildings Fund established under section 592 of title 40, United States Code, for measures necessary to convert facilities of the Administrator of General Services to high-performance green buildings (as defined in section 401 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17061)). 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2764AB44E9FF4328B266686B3918D471"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60503.
               USE OF LOW-CARBON MATERIALS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H12A5C108DE4F42D09171CBF58B0F8C2D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Appropriation
                  In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,150,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to be deposited in the Federal Buildings Fund established under section 592 of title 40, United States Code, to acquire and install materials and products for use in the construction or alteration of buildings under the jurisdiction, custody, and control of the General Services Administration that have substantially lower levels of embodied greenhouse gas emissions associated with all relevant stages of production, use, and disposal as compared to estimated industry averages of similar materials or products, as determined by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H07E813B4CD014717AE3396847DD85567"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Definition of greenhouse gas
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H0E24BD9563B7415FBAC6D04A5909C215"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60504.
               GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Administrator of General Services for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $975,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to be deposited in the Federal Buildings Fund established under section 592 of title 40, United States Code, for emerging and sustainable technologies, and related sustainability and environmental programs. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H89722827271D4F278D9C07540626F205"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60505.
               ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW IMPLEMENTATION FUNDS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1DEDA5BF92AD477297EF16FC580C88DE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H712802045BF54D1A8C059DCBD0944995"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HD3BF855E9C28447C83F54A8F6B457FEE"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        178.
                        ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW IMPLEMENTATION FUNDS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HFC3F7CBAB79242D489C6AAE5709ECADF"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Establishment
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, for fiscal year 2022, there is appropriated to the Administrator, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $100,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for the purpose of facilitating the development and review of documents for the environmental review process for proposed projects through—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0E7F54BFBD394D47AC9900AF39008091"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              the provision of guidance, technical assistance, templates, training, or tools to facilitate an efficient and effective environmental review process for surface transportation projects and any administrative expenses of the Federal Highway Administration to conduct activities described in this section; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB4247C85CC054E5D916A5A98D5E03DCD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              providing funds made available under this subsection to eligible entities—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5AE204FB080148CA87DED22ED30E446C"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 to build capacity of such eligible entities to conduct environmental review processes;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H24AC935DECBD41BAB50A83BECDB92A11"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 to facilitate the environmental review process for proposed projects by—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF906411049CE496F906CB38D76EB90A6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    defining the scope or study areas;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H28216C14957846BABDF27D03FA90B1B7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    identifying impacts, mitigation measures, and reasonable alternatives;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H092E2E9142BD4C4D9312D9EEA4ED2764"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    preparing planning and environmental studies and other documents prior to and during the environmental review process, for potential use in the environmental review process in accordance with applicable statutes and regulations;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF2AB358914234C1FAA79BE48DB96766A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iv)
                                    conducting public engagement activities; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H845D1F5AA3BF4A4584A311DB6F766A65"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (v)
                                    carrying out permitting or other activities, as the Administrator determines to be appropriate, to support the timely completion of an environmental review process required for a proposed project; and
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEC0CDEAA1DED4C4CB1AD44DDB63B56A2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 for administrative expenses of the eligible entity to conduct any of the activities described in subparagraphs (A) and (B).
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H3BDAC7CDAE104BC192B19C31FBC7AA3D"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Cost share
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE9FB8594DC3C4DD08FBB3A907895EE2A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Federal share of the cost of an activity carried out under this section by an eligible entity shall be not more than 80 percent.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC17F0B2087554995BAF049D35070C8DA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Source of funds
                              The non-Federal share of the cost of an activity carried out under this section by an eligible entity may be satisfied using funds made available to the eligible entity under any other Federal, State, or local grant program.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HF2DF2B943A504D4B9A4D9656798FCE89"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Definitions
                           In this section:
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6767C6B19C0B4332A2B3E0DCD879DC7F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Administrator
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">Administrator means the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8A42E868B9FB484698DB1993BA3F1F99"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Eligible entity
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">eligible entity means—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7791E3B5C1D74EFD9D4143C5EBCF8F74"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 a State;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HAB591102702A44239D32CACA477CE9A2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 a unit of local government;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H69ED2BE1226F4127AB7EAA90D527EB54"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 a political subdivision of a State;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5A7FBFEF25054B31A16DF30C4E17142D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 a territory of the United States;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB88B21CE453D4DAAAB1DE2000DFC0F27"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 an entity described in section 207(m)(1)(E);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB1BD449D92994D1F84B8B9EDAFDFF5B2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (F)
                                 a recipient of funds under section 203; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0CCF3A0F891246B5916EC63234BC00C0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (G)
                                 a metropolitan planning organization (as defined in section 134(b)(2)).
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H97D96E49BC56489CB63035DC97A29777"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Environmental review process
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">environmental review process has the meaning given the term in section 139(a)(5).
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H43CC70B3310943B8AB4C60FF968D7964"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Proposed project
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">proposed project means a surface transportation project for which an environmental review process is required.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H531F348843284DCB95C323B246085348"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HAA303C7E92DB4728AF27CD4BFFE9F8EA"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        178. Environmental review implementation funds.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8C605267E3E0403C920CF8C435F5D986"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               60506.
               LOW-CARBON TRANSPORTATION MATERIALS GRANTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8C339210D0054C6CBE9B907D9377AE6E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H37ABB6BAB7514E39B6C2C67E17E12C62"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HBD62CCBAA9C344BFB8848D783BD781B6"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        179.
                        LOW-CARBON TRANSPORTATION MATERIALS GRANTS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA2E9F3CC1CD449AD9F739BCC3AB92244"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Federal highway administration appropriation
                           In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,000,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to the Administrator to reimburse or provide incentives to eligible recipients for the use, in projects, of construction materials and products that have substantially lower levels of embodied greenhouse gas emissions associated with all relevant stages of production, use, and disposal as compared to estimated industry averages of similar materials or products, as determined by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and for the operations and administration of the Federal Highway Administration to carry out this section.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H4C3A838240B24DD692FBA0977B4E8689"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Reimbursement of incremental costs; incentives
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4685BFA3BD8C4B40B8B159C618C101CF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Administrator shall, subject to the availability of funds, either reimburse or provide incentives to eligible recipients that use low-embodied carbon construction materials and products on a project funded under this title.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9347A080B9B34E1A87DA956182F3D692"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Reimbursement and incentive amounts
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6387CC711CC345D6ACA23705DAB76726"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Incremental amount
                                 The amount of reimbursement under paragraph (1) shall be equal to the incrementally higher cost of using such materials relative to the cost of using traditional materials, as determined by the eligible recipient and verified by the Administrator.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HACA913CB87BC4CD28D363DAFFE671770"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Incentive amount
                                 The amount of an incentive under paragraph (1) shall be equal to 2 percent of the cost of using low-embodied carbon construction materials and products on a project funded under this title. 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H51D7D45A33BA467CB8778C6B2C5068E9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Federal share
                              If a reimbursement or incentive is provided under paragraph (1), the total Federal share payable for the project for which the reimbursement or incentive is provided shall be up to 100 percent.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB4F0B8071F934AAD929FBDD9A5A6DFBD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Limitations
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6D1CD61E28B445A4ABB3F3C053013FDD"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 The Administrator shall only provide a reimbursement or incentive under paragraph (1) for a project on a—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6CAC17C9751C4CCCB5DFA92554A34CE6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    Federal-aid highway;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H86A5FEFC596D444DB5025EDC6B4BB32D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    tribal transportation facility;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCEE0DAC95E954F5CAFB7ABD4814687F5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    Federal lands transportation facility; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBAE4146CE76A4FDEB397D706C1373829"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iv)
                                    Federal lands access transportation facility.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3B07355795074897AA059DF55E6D175F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Other restrictions
                                 Amounts made available under this section shall not be subject to any restriction or limitation on the total amount of funds available for implementation or execution of programs authorized for Federal-aid highways.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H93318BA1F14C4A6F93A8B6ACE44B0096"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 Single occupant passenger vehicles
                                 Funds made available under this section shall not be used for projects that result in additional through travel lanes for single occupant passenger vehicles.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAEACCC06B8A843CCBB196922953DD0FD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              Materials identification
                              The Administrator shall review the low-embodied carbon construction materials and products identified by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and shall identify low-embodied carbon construction materials and products—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4471D9BD7E194EDE98BD367C9F9ABFB6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 appropriate for use in projects eligible under this title; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF83AF6E62E704EA2B1485210E6D0E35A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 eligible for reimbursement or incentives under this section.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H3552B482BC7E4E00813C79295D098B87"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Definitions
                           In this section:
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCAF514E8F209456390F59B6CA2918953"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Administrator
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">Administrator means the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF4B97EEFA9A547F9B187CA201D964BB7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Eligible recipient
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">eligible recipient means—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9EC6CF1EE1A140209ADF6725CB65DE9D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 a State;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7704A243844740B98F9076A4ABE2AC4A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 a unit of local government;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H335B909ED49B43C3B0433E5B2AA351C8"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 a political subdivision of a State;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA859C5E1AFD84FDFB6A6E0055B896E9B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 a territory of the United States;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H81FB1BF1099F4CAB8E74499C17BCB54F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 an entity described in section 207(m)(1)(E);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H84689423EF6546B7A2B1FEF96F1C42D7"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (F)
                                 a recipient of funds under section 203;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H509FC0A02E7B4B3D96A23226C29C0913"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (G)
                                 a metropolitan planning organization (as defined in section 134(b)(2)); or 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFAE4FBC41D16497FB59643B8F4E28237"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (H)
                                 a special purpose district or public authority with a transportation function.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H163DB7A14F894ECBBBE5AE2CAD4BFBCE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Greenhouse gas
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">greenhouse gas means the air pollutants carbon dioxide, hydrofluorocarbons, methane, nitrous oxide, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4552B350E21B48748C4C427F80CEFDE2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HF8D7702D82F4475788AB24C79A531D20"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        179. Low-carbon transportation materials grants.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
         
      
      <title id="H017F4942718A4CDE8EEFC40C7F229377"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         VII
         COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY AND GOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H527109363822499DAFAC79F7F30037B2"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70001.
            DHS OFFICE OF CHIEF READINESS SUPPORT OFFICER
            In addition to the amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary of Homeland Security for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $500,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2028, for the Office of the Chief Readiness Support Officer to carry out sustainability and environmental programs. 
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE33F840CEECE4503BE2F7DC66C00D979"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70002.
            UNITED STATES POSTAL SERVICE CLEAN FLEETS
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the United States Postal Service for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, the following amounts, to be deposited into the Postal Service Fund established under section 2003 of title 39, United States Code:
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H26EC5537CEA14F4980DED2F4D39D7E38"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               $1,290,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for the purchase of zero-emission delivery vehicles.
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HAB13DD95CEFD4F9A962F577389A3A1AA"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               $1,710,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, for the purchase, design, and installation of the requisite infrastructure to support zero-emission delivery vehicles at facilities that the United States Postal Service owns or leases from non-Federal entities.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HD02208B19F7E4EC59CE1FD59FEC276FE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70003.
            UNITED STATES POSTAL SERVICE OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Office of Inspector General of the United States Postal Service for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $15,000,000, to remain available through September 30, 2031, to support oversight of United States Postal Service activities implemented pursuant to this Act.
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HC509009BFB2E4B1A81EA17AB6331DA38"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70004.
            GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY OFFICE OVERSIGHT
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Comptroller General of the United States for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $25,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for necessary expenses of the Government Accountability Office to support the oversight of—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HA887972A4E6D4BD58DEB90A727BD8B30"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               the distribution and use of funds appropriated under this Act; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H512A4A3A055C4AC9A4ADFE8667AD3950"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               whether the economic, social, and environmental impacts of the funds described in paragraph (1) are equitable. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE298E10B7C0041AF87FFD1FBFACE464D"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70005.
            OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET OVERSIGHT
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there are appropriated to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $25,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for necessary expenses to—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H49855D6639D74F7CB52480088C0CFFF6"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               oversee the implementation of this Act; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H86814E0F3A8A44C0B10222D7DAF8C7F2"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               track labor, equity, and environmental standards and performance. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H47EA52B284864A24B025ED7F814F23E2"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70006.
            FEMA BUILDING MATERIALS PROGRAM
            Through September 30, 2026, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency may provide financial assistance under sections 203(h), 404(a), and 406(b) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5133(h), 42 U.S.C. 5170c(a), 42 U.S.C. 5172(b)) for—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HEB50FD28FE644410B814B9B396B580B7"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               costs associated with low-carbon materials; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HFCB3A3D1340D48608D89B48EDB9DE55E"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               incentives that encourage low-carbon and net-zero energy projects.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H800965CAE3B64B9381FC4B31C1F55867"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            70007.
            FEDERAL PERMITTING IMPROVEMENT STEERING COUNCIL ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW IMPROVEMENT FUND MANDATORY FUNDING
            In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Federal Permitting Improvement Steering Council Environmental Review Improvement Fund, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $350,000,000 for fiscal year 2023, to remain available through September 30, 2031.
         
      
      <title id="H2B5AE6F2E2914C4B809424FAFD31CBF5"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         VIII
         COMMITTEE ON INDIAN AFFAIRS
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7B584C98C8234E088A337DA97718D3F6"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            80001.
            TRIBAL CLIMATE RESILIENCE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H107DDB27B1FF41F69544DA41B352A0A0"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Tribal climate resilience and adaptation
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Director of the Bureau of Indian Affairs for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $220,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for Tribal climate resilience and adaptation programs.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEE20A381E6AB4A1C8F8F240CA0A8E98A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Bureau of indian affairs fish hatcheries
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Director of the Bureau of Indian Affairs for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $10,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for fish hatchery operations and maintenance programs of the Bureau of Indian Affairs.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H04E4CAD486DB404DBB31108333D17D7A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Administration
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Director of the Bureau of Indian Affairs for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $5,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the administrative costs of carrying out this section. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEFBC2F8F096F4A2A871790E08960ABAB"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Cost-sharing and matching requirements
               None of the funds provided by this section shall be subject to cost-sharing or matching requirements.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H077E7840EACF4510B047ABAAA6EFC11D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Small and needy program
               Amounts made available under this section shall be excluded from the calculation of funds received by those Tribal governments that participate in the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Small and Needy program.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H40F0F6BF389240F09DE827CAB4B8C42A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (f)
               Distribution; use of funds
               Amounts made available under this section that are distributed to Indian Tribes and Tribal organizations for services pursuant to a self-determination contract (as defined in subsection (j) of section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304(j))) or a self-governance compact entered into pursuant to subsection (a) of section 404 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5364(a))—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H276E6B034DC44707816E38A2848711B9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  shall be distributed on a 1-time basis;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD2B3E58F970C4015BC370AE01D5BBF6A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  shall not be part of the amount required by subsections (a) through (b) of section 106 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5325(a)–(b)); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFCCDCD58F92E4014B9BD6A167CDA0F7A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  shall only be used for the purposes identified under the applicable subsection.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H3480C7CAE1434A4D8D8C66616ADCD9C3"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            80002.
            NATIVE HAWAIIAN CLIMATE RESILIENCE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H474BEA72677A4107898B190868F16335"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Native hawaiian climate resilience and adaptation
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Senior Program Director of the Office of Native Hawaiian Relations for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $23,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, to carry out, through financial assistance, technical assistance, direct expenditure, grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements, climate resilience and adaptation activities that serve the Native Hawaiian Community.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H655794EBA34848AD9B5585FE0532F2B4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Administration
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Senior Program Director of the Office of Native Hawaiian Relations for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $1,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the administrative costs of carrying out this section. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2DCF703766294D199680F2F2A6E6FA01"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Cost-sharing and matching requirements
               None of the funds provided by this section shall be subject to cost-sharing or matching requirements.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H468C1D41590B4718B1C937239E91BC5B"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            80003.
            TRIBAL ELECTRIFICATION PROGRAM
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H4907262FDCC34EC989698059D04FC5CE"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Tribal electrification program
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Director of the Bureau of Indian Affairs for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $145,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB265DBDFE3744B20989850ED727D37A0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the provision of electricity to unelectrified Tribal homes through zero-emissions energy systems;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6D9683DC22CD417C87171FBC4469FB49"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  transitioning electrified Tribal homes to zero-emissions energy systems; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H12BB2B5350174CBF8FC453AE66838A82"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  associated home repairs and retrofitting necessary to install the zero-emissions energy systems authorized under paragraphs (1) and (2).
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD6D0A58A623540F4B0A22F4D70349949"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Administration
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Director of the Bureau of Indian Affairs for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $4,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the administrative costs of carrying out this section.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H45C972F4F6A1437A890DFEDFD004EEE2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Cost-sharing and matching requirements
               None of the funds provided by this section shall be subject to cost-sharing or matching requirements.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H371CC42E1EA84E779AAADD3D7E50B63B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Small and needy program
               Amounts made available under this section shall be excluded from the calculation of funds received by those Tribal governments that participate in the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Small and Needy program.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFA3DD585E7EC489498DB15BE4AB691B1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Distribution; use of funds
               Amounts made available under this section that are distributed to Indian Tribes and Tribal organizations for services pursuant to a self-determination contract (as defined in subsection (j) of section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304(j))) or a self-governance compact entered into pursuant to subsection (a) of section 404 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5364(a))—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8E3E100677BF4E78BF7E4666255839E7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  shall be distributed on a 1-time basis;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA0C400B2B2514B458E5ECDF0F2A79E6C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  shall not be part of the amount required by subsections (a) through (b) of section 106 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5325(a)–(b)); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0F99D424F49345ED8A89C3E36D6B6A90"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  shall only be used for the purposes identified under the applicable subsection.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9B2DC5CA258742049DD1C0F4A24286F5"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            80004.
            EMERGENCY DROUGHT RELIEF FOR TRIBES
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE142A096D19B44D2A50FCBFDD3C14AE0"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Emergency drought relief for Tribes
               In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Commissioner of the Bureau of Reclamation for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $12,500,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, for near-term drought relief actions to mitigate drought impacts for Indian Tribes that are impacted by the operation of a Bureau of Reclamation water project, including through direct financial assistance to address drinking water shortages and to mitigate the loss of Tribal trust resources.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H181CBC1CBFAE47E29AE33BF6D3220701"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Cost-sharing and matching requirements
               None of the funds provided by this section shall be subject to cost-sharing or matching requirements. 
            
         
      
   
   Approved August 16, 2022.
